content: 1 Then Moab revolted against Israel, after the death of Ahab.
content_old: 1 Then Moab revolted against Israel, after the death of Ahab.

content: 2 And Ahaziah fell through the lattice in his upper chamber､ which was in Samaria､ and becamesick,—so he sent messengers､ and said unto them— Go enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron, whether I shall recover from this sickness.
content_old: 2 And Ahaziah fell through the lattice in his upper chamber､ which was in Samaria､ and becamesick,—so he sent messengers､ and said unto them— Go enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron, whether I shall recover from this sickness.

content: 3 But the messenger of Yahweh spake unto Elijah the Tishbite, Rise､ go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria,—and say unto them— Is it because there is no God in Israel that ye are going to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron?
content_old: 3 But the messenger of Yahweh spake unto Elijah the Tishbite, Rise､ go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria,—and say unto them— Is it because there is no God in Israel that ye are going to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron?

content: 4 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh, From the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die. And Elijah departed.
content_old: 4 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh, From the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die. And Elijah departed.

content: 5 And when the messengers returned unto him he said unto them— How is it that ye have returned?
content_old: 5 And when the messengers returned unto him he said unto them— How is it that ye have returned?

content: 6 And they said unto him— A man came up to meet us､ and said unto us— Go､ return unto the king who sent you, and ye shall say unto him､ Thus saith Yahweh— Is it because there is no God in Israel that thou art sending to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron? Therefore from the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die.
content_old: 6 And they said unto him— A man came up to meet us､ and said unto us— Go､ return unto the king who sent you, and ye shall say unto him､ Thus saith Yahweh— Is it because there is no God in Israel that thou art sending to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron? Therefore from the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die.

content: 7 And he said unto them, What was the manner of the man who came up to meet you,—and spake unto you these words?
content_old: 7 And he said unto them, What was the manner of the man who came up to meet you,—and spake unto you these words?

content: 8 And they said unto him— A hairy man, with a leathern girdle girt about his loins. And he said— Elijah the Tishbite it was.
content_old: 8 And they said unto him— A hairy man, with a leathern girdle girt about his loins. And he said— Elijah the Tishbite it was.

content: 9 Then sent he unto him a captain of fifty､ with his fifty,—and he went up unto him､ and lo! he abode on the top of the mountain, and he said unto him, O man of God! the king hath said､ Come down!
content_old: 9 Then sent he unto him a captain of fifty､ with his fifty,—and he went up unto him､ and lo! he abode on the top of the mountain, and he said unto him, O man of God! the king hath said､ Come down!

content: 10 And Elijah responded and said unto the captain of fifty, If､ then､ a man of God I am let fire come down out of the heavens, and devour thee and thy fifty. So there came down fire out of the heavens, and devoured him and his fifty.
content_old: 10 And Elijah responded and said unto the captain of fifty, If､ then､ a man of God I am let fire come down out of the heavens, and devour thee and thy fifty. So there came down fire out of the heavens, and devoured him and his fifty.

content: 11 Then he again sent unto him another captain of fifty､ with his fifty. And he also spake and said unto him, O man of God! thus saith the king､ Haste thee､ come down!
content_old: 11 Then he again sent unto him another captain of fifty､ with his fifty. And he also spake and said unto him, O man of God! thus saith the king､ Haste thee､ come down!

content: 12 And Elijah responded and said unto them— If a man of God I am let fire come down out of the heavens, and devour thee and thy fifty. And there came down a fire of God､ out of the heavens, and devoured him and his fifty.
content_old: 12 And Elijah responded and said unto them— If a man of God I am let fire come down out of the heavens, and devour thee and thy fifty. And there came down a fire of God､ out of the heavens, and devoured him and his fifty.

content: 13 Then he again sent a third captain of fifty､ with his fifty,—and the third captain of fifty ascended and came near､ and bowed down upon his knees before Elijah､ and made supplication unto him､ and said unto him, O man of God! let my life､ I pray thee､ and the lives of these thy fifty servants､ be precious in thine eyes.
content_old: 13 Then he again sent a third captain of fifty､ with his fifty,—and the third captain of fifty ascended and came near､ and bowed down upon his knees before Elijah､ and made supplication unto him､ and said unto him, O man of God! let my life､ I pray thee､ and the lives of these thy fifty servants､ be precious in thine eyes.

content: 14 Lo! there hath come down fire out of the heavens, and devoured the captains of the former fifties､ with their fifties,—now therefore､ let my life be precious in thine eyes.
content_old: 14 Lo! there hath come down fire out of the heavens, and devoured the captains of the former fifties､ with their fifties,—now therefore､ let my life be precious in thine eyes.

content: 15 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Elijah, Go down with him, do not fear because of him, So he arose､ and went down with him､ unto the king;
content_old: 15 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Elijah, Go down with him, do not fear because of him, So he arose､ and went down with him､ unto the king;

content: 16 and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh— For that thou didst send messengers to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron was it because there was no God in Israel, for whose word thou couldst enquire? Therefore from the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die.
content_old: 16 and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh— For that thou didst send messengers to enquire of Baalzebub､ god of Ekron was it because there was no God in Israel, for whose word thou couldst enquire? Therefore from the bed whereunto thou hast gone up shalt thou not come down､ for thou shalt surely die.

content: 17 And he died､ according to the word of Yahweh which Elijah had spoken, and Jehoram reigned in his stead, in the second year of Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah,—because he had no son.
content_old: 17 And he died､ according to the word of Yahweh which Elijah had spoken, and Jehoram reigned in his stead, in the second year of Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah,—because he had no son.

content: 1 And it came to pass when Yahweh was about to take up Elijah in a storm into the heavens that Elijah departed､ with Elisha､ from Gilgal.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when Yahweh was about to take up Elijah in a storm into the heavens that Elijah departed､ with Elisha､ from Gilgal.

content: 2 Then said Elijah unto Elisha— Tarry here､ I pray thee､ for Yahweh hath sent me as far as Bethel. And Elisha said, By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.
content_old: 2 Then said Elijah unto Elisha— Tarry here､ I pray thee､ for Yahweh hath sent me as far as Bethel. And Elisha said, By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.

content: 3 And the sons of the prophets who were in Bethel came forth unto Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that, to-day, Yahweh is taking away thy lord､ from thy head? And he said— I also know､ be silent.
content_old: 3 And the sons of the prophets who were in Bethel came forth unto Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that, to-day, Yahweh is taking away thy lord､ from thy head? And he said— I also know､ be silent.

content: 4 Then Elijah said to him— Elisha､ I pray thee､ tarry here､ for Yahweh hath sent me to Jericho. And he said— By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.
content_old: 4 Then Elijah said to him— Elisha､ I pray thee､ tarry here､ for Yahweh hath sent me to Jericho. And he said— By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.

content: 5 Then drew near the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho､ unto Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that､ to-day､ Yahweh is taking away thy lord from thy head? And he said— I also know; be silent.
content_old: 5 Then drew near the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho､ unto Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that､ to-day､ Yahweh is taking away thy lord from thy head? And he said— I also know; be silent.

content: 6 And Elijah said to him— Tarry here､ I pray thee､ for Yahweh hath sent me to the Jordan. And he said— By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they two went on.
content_old: 6 And Elijah said to him— Tarry here､ I pray thee､ for Yahweh hath sent me to the Jordan. And he said— By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So they two went on.

content: 7 But fifty men of the sons of the prophets came, and stood over against them､ afar off,—and they two stood by the Jordan.
content_old: 7 But fifty men of the sons of the prophets came, and stood over against them､ afar off,—and they two stood by the Jordan.

content: 8 Then Elijah took his mantle､ and wrapped it together､ and smote the waters, and they were divided､ hither and thither,—so that they two passed over on dry ground.
content_old: 8 Then Elijah took his mantle､ and wrapped it together､ and smote the waters, and they were divided､ hither and thither,—so that they two passed over on dry ground.

content: 9 And it came to pass as they went over that Elijah said unto Elisha— Ask､ what I shall do for thee, ere yet I be taken from thee. And Elisha said, Let there be､ I pray thee､ a double portion of thy spirit upon me.
content_old: 9 And it came to pass as they went over that Elijah said unto Elisha— Ask､ what I shall do for thee, ere yet I be taken from thee. And Elisha said, Let there be､ I pray thee､ a double portion of thy spirit upon me.

content: 10 And he said— Thou hast asked a hard thing,—if thou see me when taken from thee thou shalt have it so, but if not thou shalt not have it.
content_old: 10 And he said— Thou hast asked a hard thing,—if thou see me when taken from thee thou shalt have it so, but if not thou shalt not have it.

content: 11 And it came to pass as they were going on and on and talking that lo! there was a chariot of fire, with horses of fire, which parted those two asunder,—and Elijah went up in a storm､ into the heavens.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass as they were going on and on and talking that lo! there was a chariot of fire, with horses of fire, which parted those two asunder,—and Elijah went up in a storm､ into the heavens.

content: 12 And as soon as Elisha saw it he began crying out— My father! my father! The chariots of Israel､ and the horsemen thereof! But when he could see him no longer he took hold of his clothes, and rent them in two pieces.
content_old: 12 And as soon as Elisha saw it he began crying out— My father! my father! The chariots of Israel､ and the horsemen thereof! But when he could see him no longer he took hold of his clothes, and rent them in two pieces.

content: 13 Then took he up the mantle of Elijah, which had fallen from him,—and returned and stood､ on the brink of the Jordan;
content_old: 13 Then took he up the mantle of Elijah, which had fallen from him,—and returned and stood､ on the brink of the Jordan;

content: 14 and took the mantle of Elijah which had fallen from him､ and smote the waters､ and said, Where is Yahweh､ the God of Elijah? And when he also smote the waters they wore divided､ hither and thither, and Elisha passed over.
content_old: 14 and took the mantle of Elijah which had fallen from him､ and smote the waters､ and said, Where is Yahweh､ the God of Elijah? And when he also smote the waters they wore divided､ hither and thither, and Elisha passed over.

content: 15 And when the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho､ over against him､ saw him they said, The spirit of Elijah resteth on Elisha. So they came to meet him, and bowed themselves down to him､ to the ground.
content_old: 15 And when the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho､ over against him､ saw him they said, The spirit of Elijah resteth on Elisha. So they came to meet him, and bowed themselves down to him､ to the ground.

content: 16 Then said they unto him— Lo! we pray thee､ there are with thy servants fifty men､ sons of valour—let them go､ we pray thee､ and seek thy lord, lest the Spirit of Yahweh have borne him away, and cast him on one of the mountains, or into one of the valleys. And he said— Ye shall not send.
content_old: 16 Then said they unto him— Lo! we pray thee､ there are with thy servants fifty men､ sons of valour—let them go､ we pray thee､ and seek thy lord, lest the Spirit of Yahweh have borne him away, and cast him on one of the mountains, or into one of the valleys. And he said— Ye shall not send.

content: 17 But when they urged him until he was ashamed he said— Send. So they sent fifty men, and made search three days､ but found him not.
content_old: 17 But when they urged him until he was ashamed he said— Send. So they sent fifty men, and made search three days､ but found him not.

content: 18 And when they came back unto him､ he having tarried at Jericho he said unto them, Did I not say unto you､ Do not go?
content_old: 18 And when they came back unto him､ he having tarried at Jericho he said unto them, Did I not say unto you､ Do not go?

content: 19 And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Lo! we pray thee､ the situation of the city is good, as my lord seeth,—but the waters are bad､ and the land apt to miscarry.
content_old: 19 And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Lo! we pray thee､ the situation of the city is good, as my lord seeth,—but the waters are bad､ and the land apt to miscarry.

content: 20 And he said— Bring me a new bowl, and put therein salt. So they brought it unto him;
content_old: 20 And he said— Bring me a new bowl, and put therein salt. So they brought it unto him;

content: 21 and he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast therein salt,—and said— Thus saith Yahweh､ I have healed these waters; there shall come from thence､ no longer､ death or aptness to miscarry.
content_old: 21 and he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast therein salt,—and said— Thus saith Yahweh､ I have healed these waters; there shall come from thence､ no longer､ death or aptness to miscarry.

content: 22 So the waters were healed, as they remain unto this day,— according to the word of Elisha which he spake.
content_old: 22 So the waters were healed, as they remain unto this day,— according to the word of Elisha which he spake.

content: 23 And he went up from thence､ to Bethel,—and as he was going up on the way some lads came forth､ out of the city, and made mockery of him､ and said to him, Go up､ bald head! Go up､ bald head!
content_old: 23 And he went up from thence､ to Bethel,—and as he was going up on the way some lads came forth､ out of the city, and made mockery of him､ and said to him, Go up､ bald head! Go up､ bald head!

content: 24 And when he turned round and saw them he cursed them､ in the name of Yahweh,—and there came forth two she-bears out of the wood, and tare､ of them､ forty-two youths.
content_old: 24 And when he turned round and saw them he cursed them､ in the name of Yahweh,—and there came forth two she-bears out of the wood, and tare､ of them､ forty-two youths.

content: 1 Now Jehoram､ son of Ahab began to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat､ king of Judah,—and he reigned twelve years.
content_old: 1 Now Jehoram､ son of Ahab began to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat､ king of Judah,—and he reigned twelve years.

content: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh, only not like his father､ nor like his mother,—but he put away the pillars of Baal which his father had made;
content_old: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh, only not like his father､ nor like his mother,—but he put away the pillars of Baal which his father had made;

content: 3 nevertheless unto the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat which he caused Israel to commit he did cleave,—he turned not away therefrom.
content_old: 3 nevertheless unto the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat which he caused Israel to commit he did cleave,—he turned not away therefrom.

content: 4 Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep-master,—and used to render to the king of Israel､ the wool of a hundred thousand fat sheep, and of a hundred thousand rams.
content_old: 4 Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep-master,—and used to render to the king of Israel､ the wool of a hundred thousand fat sheep, and of a hundred thousand rams.

content: 5 And it came to pass when Ahab died that the king of Moab revolted against the king of Israel.
content_old: 5 And it came to pass when Ahab died that the king of Moab revolted against the king of Israel.

content: 6 So King Jehoram went forth､ on that day､ out of Samaria､ and numbered all Israel.
content_old: 6 So King Jehoram went forth､ on that day､ out of Samaria､ and numbered all Israel.

content: 7 And he departed､ and sent unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah､ saying— The king of Moab hath revolted against me, wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said— I will go up, I am as thou art､ my people are as thy people､ my horses as thy horses.
content_old: 7 And he departed､ and sent unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah､ saying— The king of Moab hath revolted against me, wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said— I will go up, I am as thou art､ my people are as thy people､ my horses as thy horses.

content: 8 And he said— Which way then､ shall we go up? And he said— The way of the wilderness of Edom.
content_old: 8 And he said— Which way then､ shall we go up? And he said— The way of the wilderness of Edom.

content: 9 Then departed the king of Israel､ and the king of Judah､ and the king of Edom, and went round､ a journey of seven days,—and there was no water for the host, nor for the cattle that went with them.
content_old: 9 Then departed the king of Israel､ and the king of Judah､ and the king of Edom, and went round､ a journey of seven days,—and there was no water for the host, nor for the cattle that went with them.

content: 10 Then said the king of Israel— Alas! for Yahweh hath called these three kings, to deliver them into the hand of Moab.
content_old: 10 Then said the king of Israel— Alas! for Yahweh hath called these three kings, to deliver them into the hand of Moab.

content: 11 So Jehoshaphat said— Is there not､ here､ a prophet of Yahweh, that we may enquire of Yahweh from him? Then answered one of the servants of the king of Israel､ and said, Here is Elisha son of Shaphat, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.
content_old: 11 So Jehoshaphat said— Is there not､ here､ a prophet of Yahweh, that we may enquire of Yahweh from him? Then answered one of the servants of the king of Israel､ and said, Here is Elisha son of Shaphat, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.

content: 12 Then said Jehoshaphat, The word of Yahweh is with him. So the king of Israel､ and Jehoshaphat､ and the king of Edom､ went down unto him.
content_old: 12 Then said Jehoshaphat, The word of Yahweh is with him. So the king of Israel､ and Jehoshaphat､ and the king of Edom､ went down unto him.

content: 13 And Elisha said unto the king of Israel— What have I and thou in common? get thee unto the prophets of thy father, and unto the prophets of thy mother. But the king of Israel said to him— Nay! for Yahweh hath called together these three kings, to deliver them into the hand of Moab.
content_old: 13 And Elisha said unto the king of Israel— What have I and thou in common? get thee unto the prophets of thy father, and unto the prophets of thy mother. But the king of Israel said to him— Nay! for Yahweh hath called together these three kings, to deliver them into the hand of Moab.

content: 14 Then said Elisha— By the life of Yahweh of hosts､ before whom I stand were it not that the countenance of Jehoshaphat king of Judah I would lift up I would neither look at thee､ nor see thee.
content_old: 14 Then said Elisha— By the life of Yahweh of hosts､ before whom I stand were it not that the countenance of Jehoshaphat king of Judah I would lift up I would neither look at thee､ nor see thee.

content: 15 But now bring me one that can touch the strings. For it used to be when the player touched the strings then would the hand of Yahweh be upon him.
content_old: 15 But now bring me one that can touch the strings. For it used to be when the player touched the strings then would the hand of Yahweh be upon him.

content: 16 Then said he, Thus saith Yahweh,— Make､ in this torrent-bed､ pits､ pits!
content_old: 16 Then said he, Thus saith Yahweh,— Make､ in this torrent-bed､ pits､ pits!

content: 17 For thus saith Yahweh— Ye shall not see wind､ And ye shall not see rain, Yet that torrent-bed shall be filled with water,— And ye shall drink､ ye､ and your cattle､ and your beasts;
content_old: 17 For thus saith Yahweh— Ye shall not see wind､ And ye shall not see rain, Yet that torrent-bed shall be filled with water,— And ye shall drink､ ye､ and your cattle､ and your beasts;

content: 18 And this being a small thing in the eyes of Yahweh He will deliver Moab into your hand;
content_old: 18 And this being a small thing in the eyes of Yahweh He will deliver Moab into your hand;

content: 19 And ye shall smite every strong city､ and every choice city, And every goodly tree shall ye fell, And all fountains of water shall ye close up,— And every goodly heritage shall ye mar with stones.
content_old: 19 And ye shall smite every strong city､ and every choice city, And every goodly tree shall ye fell, And all fountains of water shall ye close up,— And every goodly heritage shall ye mar with stones.

content: 20 And it came to pass in the morning､ when the offering ascended that lo! waters were coming in from the way of Edom,—and the land was filled with the water.
content_old: 20 And it came to pass in the morning､ when the offering ascended that lo! waters were coming in from the way of Edom,—and the land was filled with the water.

content: 21 Now all Moab had heard that the kings had come up to fight against them,—so they came together､ from all who could gird on a girdle and upwards, and took their stand at the border.
content_old: 21 Now all Moab had heard that the kings had come up to fight against them,—so they came together､ from all who could gird on a girdle and upwards, and took their stand at the border.

content: 22 And when they rose early in the morning the sun shone forth upon the waters,—and so the Moabites beheld over against them､ the waters､ red as as blood.
content_old: 22 And when they rose early in the morning the sun shone forth upon the waters,—and so the Moabites beheld over against them､ the waters､ red as as blood.

content: 23 They said therefore— Blood—this! Destroyed! The kings have destroyed each other! Yea they have smitten every man his neighbour,— Now then､ to the spoil､ O Moab!
content_old: 23 They said therefore— Blood—this! Destroyed! The kings have destroyed each other! Yea they have smitten every man his neighbour,— Now then､ to the spoil､ O Moab!

content: 24 And when they came into the camp of Israel Israel arose and smote Moab, and they fled from before them,—so they entered thereinto, yea still farther entered Moab;
content_old: 24 And when they came into the camp of Israel Israel arose and smote Moab, and they fled from before them,—so they entered thereinto, yea still farther entered Moab;

content: 25 And the cities they pulled down､ And on every goodly heritage they cast every man his stone､ and filled it､ And all fountains of waters they closed up, And every goodly tree they felled, and though they left the stones thereof in Kir-haraseth yet the slingers surrounded and smote it.
content_old: 25 And the cities they pulled down､ And on every goodly heritage they cast every man his stone､ and filled it､ And all fountains of waters they closed up, And every goodly tree they felled, and though they left the stones thereof in Kir-haraseth yet the slingers surrounded and smote it.

content: 26 And when the king of Moab saw that the battle prevailed against him he took with him seven hundred men that drew swords､ to break through against the king of Edom, but they could not.
content_old: 26 And when the king of Moab saw that the battle prevailed against him he took with him seven hundred men that drew swords､ to break through against the king of Edom, but they could not.

content: 1 Now a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets made outcry unto Elisha､ saying— Thy servant､ my husband is dead, and thou knowest that thy servant was one who revered Yahweh,—now the creditor hath come to take my two boys to himself as bondmen.
content_old: 1 Now a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets made outcry unto Elisha､ saying— Thy servant､ my husband is dead, and thou knowest that thy servant was one who revered Yahweh,—now the creditor hath come to take my two boys to himself as bondmen.

content: 2 And Elisha said unto her— What shall I do for thee? tell me what thou hast､ in the house. And she said— Thy maid-servant hath nothing at all in the house, save a flask of oil.
content_old: 2 And Elisha said unto her— What shall I do for thee? tell me what thou hast､ in the house. And she said— Thy maid-servant hath nothing at all in the house, save a flask of oil.

content: 3 And he said— Go, ask thee vessels､ from without, of all thy neighbours,—empty vessels let them not be few.
content_old: 3 And he said— Go, ask thee vessels､ from without, of all thy neighbours,—empty vessels let them not be few.

content: 4 And when thou hast come in then shalt thou shut the door behind thee and behind thy sons, and shalt pour out into all these vessels,—and that which is full shalt thou set aside.
content_old: 4 And when thou hast come in then shalt thou shut the door behind thee and behind thy sons, and shalt pour out into all these vessels,—and that which is full shalt thou set aside.

content: 5 So she went out from his presence, and shut the door behind her､ and behind her sons,—they bringing near to her､ and she pouring out.
content_old: 5 So she went out from his presence, and shut the door behind her､ and behind her sons,—they bringing near to her､ and she pouring out.

content: 6 And it came to pass when the vessels were full that she said unto her son— Bring me a vessel more. And he said unto her— There is not a vessel more. And the oil stayed.
content_old: 6 And it came to pass when the vessels were full that she said unto her son— Bring me a vessel more. And he said unto her— There is not a vessel more. And the oil stayed.

content: 7 Then came she in､ and told the man of God, and he said— Go, sell the oil, and pay thy creditor,—and thou and thy sons shall live of the rest.
content_old: 7 Then came she in､ and told the man of God, and he said— Go, sell the oil, and pay thy creditor,—and thou and thy sons shall live of the rest.

content: 8 And so it was､ on a day that Elisha passed over unto Shunem､ where was a woman of position, and she constrained him to eat bread,—and so it came about whensoever he passed that way that he turned aside thither､ to eat bread.
content_old: 8 And so it was､ on a day that Elisha passed over unto Shunem､ where was a woman of position, and she constrained him to eat bread,—and so it came about whensoever he passed that way that he turned aside thither､ to eat bread.

content: 9 Then said she unto her husband, Lo! I pray thee—I perceive that a holy man of God he is,—passing our way continually.
content_old: 9 Then said she unto her husband, Lo! I pray thee—I perceive that a holy man of God he is,—passing our way continually.

content: 10 I pray thee､ let us make a little upper chamber on the wall and set for him there—a bed､ and a table､ and a seat､ and a lampstand,—so shall it be when he cometh to us that he can turn in thither.
content_old: 10 I pray thee､ let us make a little upper chamber on the wall and set for him there—a bed､ and a table､ and a seat､ and a lampstand,—so shall it be when he cometh to us that he can turn in thither.

content: 11 And it came to pass､ on a day､ that he came thither,—so he turned aside into the upper chamber､ and slept there.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass､ on a day､ that he came thither,—so he turned aside into the upper chamber､ and slept there.

content: 12 Then said he unto Gehazi､ his young man, Call this Shunammitess. And he called her､ and she stood before him.
content_old: 12 Then said he unto Gehazi､ his young man, Call this Shunammitess. And he called her､ and she stood before him.

content: 13 And he said to him— I pray thee､ say unto her— Lo! thou hast cared for us with all this anxious care, what can be done for thee? Is it､ that we should speak for thee unto the king, or unto the general of the army? But she said, In the midst of mine own people do I dwell.
content_old: 13 And he said to him— I pray thee､ say unto her— Lo! thou hast cared for us with all this anxious care, what can be done for thee? Is it､ that we should speak for thee unto the king, or unto the general of the army? But she said, In the midst of mine own people do I dwell.

content: 14 So he said, What then can be done for thee? And Gehazi said, Verily she hath no son､ and her husband is old.
content_old: 14 So he said, What then can be done for thee? And Gehazi said, Verily she hath no son､ and her husband is old.

content: 15 And he said— Call her. So he called her, and she stood in the doorway.
content_old: 15 And he said— Call her. So he called her, and she stood in the doorway.

content: 16 Then said he— At this season, about the time of spring thou shalt be embracing a son. And she said— Nay! my lord､ thou man of God, do not delude thy maid-servant.
content_old: 16 Then said he— At this season, about the time of spring thou shalt be embracing a son. And she said— Nay! my lord､ thou man of God, do not delude thy maid-servant.

content: 17 And the woman conceived､ and bare a son, at this season､ about the time of spring, when Elisha had spoken unto her.
content_old: 17 And the woman conceived､ and bare a son, at this season､ about the time of spring, when Elisha had spoken unto her.

content: 18 And when the child was grown it came to pass on a certain day that he went out unto his father､ unto the reapers;
content_old: 18 And when the child was grown it came to pass on a certain day that he went out unto his father､ unto the reapers;

content: 19 and he said unto his father— My head! my head! So he said unto the young man, Carry him to his mother.
content_old: 19 and he said unto his father— My head! my head! So he said unto the young man, Carry him to his mother.

content: 20 And when he had carried him, and brought him in unto his mother he sat on her knees until noon､ and then died.
content_old: 20 And when he had carried him, and brought him in unto his mother he sat on her knees until noon､ and then died.

content: 21 And she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God,—and shut him in､ and then went out.
content_old: 21 And she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God,—and shut him in､ and then went out.

content: 22 And she called unto her husband, and said— Send me､ I pray thee､ one of the young men, and one of the asses,—that I may run unto the man of God､ and return!
content_old: 22 And she called unto her husband, and said— Send me､ I pray thee､ one of the young men, and one of the asses,—that I may run unto the man of God､ and return!

content: 23 And he said— Wherefore art thou going unto him､ to-day, neither new moon nor sabbath? And she said— Peace!
content_old: 23 And he said— Wherefore art thou going unto him､ to-day, neither new moon nor sabbath? And she said— Peace!

content: 24 Then saddled she the ass, and said unto her young man— Lead on､ and go forward,—do not slacken､ for my sake､ the riding, except I have bidden thee.
content_old: 24 Then saddled she the ass, and said unto her young man— Lead on､ and go forward,—do not slacken､ for my sake､ the riding, except I have bidden thee.

content: 25 So she went her way､ and came unto the man of God､ unto Mount Carmel. And it came to pass when the man of God saw her､ opposite that he said unto Gehazi his young man, Lo! this Shunammitess!
content_old: 25 So she went her way､ and came unto the man of God､ unto Mount Carmel. And it came to pass when the man of God saw her､ opposite that he said unto Gehazi his young man, Lo! this Shunammitess!

content: 26 Now run､ I pray thee､ to meet her, and say to her— Is it well with thee? is it well with thy husband? is it well with the child? And she said, Well!
content_old: 26 Now run､ I pray thee､ to meet her, and say to her— Is it well with thee? is it well with thy husband? is it well with the child? And she said, Well!

content: 27 But when she came unto the man of God､ on the mount she caught hold of his feet,—and Gehazi drew near to thrust her away､ when the man of God said— Let her alone! for her life is embittered to her, howbeit Yahweh hath hidden it from me, and hath not told me.
content_old: 27 But when she came unto the man of God､ on the mount she caught hold of his feet,—and Gehazi drew near to thrust her away､ when the man of God said— Let her alone! for her life is embittered to her, howbeit Yahweh hath hidden it from me, and hath not told me.

content: 28 Then said she, Did I ask a son､ of my lord? Said I not, Thou must not mislead me?
content_old: 28 Then said she, Did I ask a son､ of my lord? Said I not, Thou must not mislead me?

content: 29 And he said to Gehazi— Gird thy loins､ and take my staff in thy hand､ and go thy way, if thou meet with any man thou must not bless him, and if any man bless thee thou must not respond to him,—then shalt thou lay my staff upon the face of the boy.
content_old: 29 And he said to Gehazi— Gird thy loins､ and take my staff in thy hand､ and go thy way, if thou meet with any man thou must not bless him, and if any man bless thee thou must not respond to him,—then shalt thou lay my staff upon the face of the boy.

content: 30 But the mother of the boy said, By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So he arose and followed her.
content_old: 30 But the mother of the boy said, By the life of Yahweh and by the life of thine own soul I will not leave thee. So he arose and followed her.

content: 31 Now Gehazi had passed on before them､ and laid the staff on the face of the boy, but there was neither voice､ nor attention,—so he returned to meet him､ and told him､ saying— The boy hath not awaked.
content_old: 31 Now Gehazi had passed on before them､ and laid the staff on the face of the boy, but there was neither voice､ nor attention,—so he returned to meet him､ and told him､ saying— The boy hath not awaked.

content: 32 And when Elisha had come into the house lo! the boy was dead, laid upon his bed.
content_old: 32 And when Elisha had come into the house lo! the boy was dead, laid upon his bed.

content: 33 So he went in､ and shut the door upon them two,—and prayed unto Yahweh.
content_old: 33 So he went in､ and shut the door upon them two,—and prayed unto Yahweh.

content: 34 Then gat he up､ and lay upon the child､ and put his own mouth upon his mouth､ and his own eyes upon his eyes､ and his own hands upon his hands, and bowed himself upon him,—and the flesh of the child waxed warm.
content_old: 34 Then gat he up､ and lay upon the child､ and put his own mouth upon his mouth､ and his own eyes upon his eyes､ and his own hands upon his hands, and bowed himself upon him,—and the flesh of the child waxed warm.

content: 35 Then returned he､ and walked in the house—once to and fro, and then went up and bowed himself upon him,—and the boy sneezed as many as seven times, and the boy opened his eyes.
content_old: 35 Then returned he､ and walked in the house—once to and fro, and then went up and bowed himself upon him,—and the boy sneezed as many as seven times, and the boy opened his eyes.

content: 36 Then called he Gehazi､ and said— Call this Shunammitess. So he called her､ and when she was come in unto him he said— Take up thy son.
content_old: 36 Then called he Gehazi､ and said— Call this Shunammitess. So he called her､ and when she was come in unto him he said— Take up thy son.

content: 37 So she came in､ and fell at his feet, and bowed herself to the ground,—and took up her son､ and went forth.
content_old: 37 So she came in､ and fell at his feet, and bowed herself to the ground,—and took up her son､ and went forth.

content: 38 Now Elisha returned to Gilgal､ and there was a famine in the land, and the sons of the prophets being seated before him he said to his young man— Put on the large pot, and boil a mess of food､ for the sons of the prophets.
content_old: 38 Now Elisha returned to Gilgal､ and there was a famine in the land, and the sons of the prophets being seated before him he said to his young man— Put on the large pot, and boil a mess of food､ for the sons of the prophets.

content: 39 And one went out into the field､ to gather herbs, and found a vine in the field, and gathered thereof wild gourds､ his lap full,—and came in､ and sliced them into the pot; for they knew them not.
content_old: 39 And one went out into the field､ to gather herbs, and found a vine in the field, and gathered thereof wild gourds､ his lap full,—and came in､ and sliced them into the pot; for they knew them not.

content: 40 So they poured out for the men to eat,—and it came to pass as they were eating of the mess that they made outcry and said— Death in the pot､ O man of God! And they could not eat.
content_old: 40 So they poured out for the men to eat,—and it came to pass as they were eating of the mess that they made outcry and said— Death in the pot､ O man of God! And they could not eat.

content: 41 And he said—Then fetch meal. And he cast it into the pot,—and then said—Pour out for the people､ that they may eat. And there was no harm in the pot.
content_old: 41 And he said—Then fetch meal. And he cast it into the pot,—and then said—Pour out for the people､ that they may eat. And there was no harm in the pot.

content: 42 And a man came in from Baal-shalishah､ and brought for the man of God firstfruit bread､ twenty barley loaves､ and garden grain in the husk thereof. And he said— Give to the people､ that they may eat.
content_old: 42 And a man came in from Baal-shalishah､ and brought for the man of God firstfruit bread､ twenty barley loaves､ and garden grain in the husk thereof. And he said— Give to the people､ that they may eat.

content: 43 But his attendant said— How can I set this before a hundred men? And he said— Give to the people､ that they may eat, for Thus saith Yahweh､ They are about to eat and to leave remaining.
content_old: 43 But his attendant said— How can I set this before a hundred men? And he said— Give to the people､ that they may eat, for Thus saith Yahweh､ They are about to eat and to leave remaining.

content: 1 Now Naaman､ general of the army of the king of Syria was a great man in presence of his lord､ and held in honour, because by him had Yahweh given deliverance to Syria,—and the man was a hero of valour—but a leper.
content_old: 1 Now Naaman､ general of the army of the king of Syria was a great man in presence of his lord､ and held in honour, because by him had Yahweh given deliverance to Syria,—and the man was a hero of valour—but a leper.

content: 2 Now the Syrians had gone out in companies, and had brought back out of the land of Israel､ a little maiden,—who became an attendant on the wife of Naaman.
content_old: 2 Now the Syrians had gone out in companies, and had brought back out of the land of Israel､ a little maiden,—who became an attendant on the wife of Naaman.

content: 3 And she said unto her mistress, Ah! would that my lord were before the prophet､ who is in Samaria! then would he set him free from his leprosy.
content_old: 3 And she said unto her mistress, Ah! would that my lord were before the prophet､ who is in Samaria! then would he set him free from his leprosy.

content: 4 And he went in and told his lord､ saying,— Thus and thus hath spoken the maiden who is of the land of Israel!
content_old: 4 And he went in and told his lord､ saying,— Thus and thus hath spoken the maiden who is of the land of Israel!

content: 5 And the king of Syria said— Go､ get in､ that I may send a letter unto the king of Israel. So he went､ and took in his hand ten talents of silver､ and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment.
content_old: 5 And the king of Syria said— Go､ get in､ that I may send a letter unto the king of Israel. So he went､ and took in his hand ten talents of silver､ and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment.

content: 6 And he brought in the letter unto the king of Israel, saying, Now therefore when this letter cometh in unto thee lo! I have sent unto thee､ Naaman my servant, and thou shalt set him free from his leprosy.
content_old: 6 And he brought in the letter unto the king of Israel, saying, Now therefore when this letter cometh in unto thee lo! I have sent unto thee､ Naaman my servant, and thou shalt set him free from his leprosy.

content: 7 And it came to pass when the king of Israel had read the letter that he rent his clothes､ and said, Am I God to kill and to make alive, that this man is sending unto me, to set one free from his leprosy,—but､ of a truth､ just mark､ I pray you､ and see, that he is seeking an occasion against me.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass when the king of Israel had read the letter that he rent his clothes､ and said, Am I God to kill and to make alive, that this man is sending unto me, to set one free from his leprosy,—but､ of a truth､ just mark､ I pray you､ and see, that he is seeking an occasion against me.

content: 8 And it was so when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes that he sent unto the king､ saying— Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come､ I pray thee､ unto me, that he may get to know that there is a prophet in Israel.
content_old: 8 And it was so when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes that he sent unto the king､ saying— Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come､ I pray thee､ unto me, that he may get to know that there is a prophet in Israel.

content: 9 So Naaman came､ with his horses and with his chariot､ and stood at the entrance of the house of Elisha;
content_old: 9 So Naaman came､ with his horses and with his chariot､ and stood at the entrance of the house of Elisha;

content: 10 and Elisha sent a messenger unto him､ saying,— Go and bathe seven times in the Jordan, so shall thy flesh come back to thee､ and be thou clean.
content_old: 10 and Elisha sent a messenger unto him､ saying,— Go and bathe seven times in the Jordan, so shall thy flesh come back to thee､ and be thou clean.

content: 11 But Naaman was wroth､ and went away,—and said— Lo! I thought Unto me will he come right out and take his stand､ and call on the name of Yahweh his God, and wave his hand towards the spot､ and so set free the leper.
content_old: 11 But Naaman was wroth､ and went away,—and said— Lo! I thought Unto me will he come right out and take his stand､ and call on the name of Yahweh his God, and wave his hand towards the spot､ and so set free the leper.

content: 12 Are not Abanah and Pharpar､ rivers of Damascus better than all the waters of Israel? may I not bathe in them､ and be clean? So he turned､ and went away in a rage.
content_old: 12 Are not Abanah and Pharpar､ rivers of Damascus better than all the waters of Israel? may I not bathe in them､ and be clean? So he turned､ and went away in a rage.

content: 13 Then drew near his servants､ and spake unto him, and said— My father! if some great thing the prophet had commanded thee wouldst thou not have done it? then how much rather when he hath said unto thee､ Bathe and be clean?
content_old: 13 Then drew near his servants､ and spake unto him, and said— My father! if some great thing the prophet had commanded thee wouldst thou not have done it? then how much rather when he hath said unto thee､ Bathe and be clean?

content: 14 Then went he down､ and dipped himself in the Jordan､ seven times, according to the word of the man of God: and his flesh came back､ as the flesh of a little child､ and he was clean.
content_old: 14 Then went he down､ and dipped himself in the Jordan､ seven times, according to the word of the man of God: and his flesh came back､ as the flesh of a little child､ and he was clean.

content: 15 And he returned unto the man of God､ he and all his company; and came､ and took his stand before him, and said— Lo! I pray thee—I know that there is no God in all the earth, save in Israel,—now therefore､ I pray thee､ accept a blessing from thy servant.
content_old: 15 And he returned unto the man of God､ he and all his company; and came､ and took his stand before him, and said— Lo! I pray thee—I know that there is no God in all the earth, save in Israel,—now therefore､ I pray thee､ accept a blessing from thy servant.

content: 16 But he said— By the life of Yahweh, before whom I stand I will not accept one. And though he urged him to accept it yet did he refuse.
content_old: 16 But he said— By the life of Yahweh, before whom I stand I will not accept one. And though he urged him to accept it yet did he refuse.

content: 17 Then said Naaman, Shall there not､ then､ I pray thee､ be given to thy servant, two mules’ burden of earth? For thy servant will henceforth offer neither ascending-offering nor sacrifice to other gods, save only to Yahweh.
content_old: 17 Then said Naaman, Shall there not､ then､ I pray thee､ be given to thy servant, two mules’ burden of earth? For thy servant will henceforth offer neither ascending-offering nor sacrifice to other gods, save only to Yahweh.

content: 18 In this thing Yahweh grant forgiveness to thy servant,— When my lord entereth the house of Rimmon､ to bow down therein､ he leaning upon my hand､ and so I bow down in the house of Rimmon, when he boweth down in the house of Rimmon Yahweh､ I pray､ grant forgiveness to thy servant､ in this thing.
content_old: 18 In this thing Yahweh grant forgiveness to thy servant,— When my lord entereth the house of Rimmon､ to bow down therein､ he leaning upon my hand､ and so I bow down in the house of Rimmon, when he boweth down in the house of Rimmon Yahweh､ I pray､ grant forgiveness to thy servant､ in this thing.

content: 19 And he said unto him— Go and prosper! But when he had gone from him some distance
content_old: 19 And he said unto him— Go and prosper! But when he had gone from him some distance

content: 20 Gehazi､ the servant of Elisha the man of God said— Lo! my lord hath restrained this Naaman the Syrian, by not taking at his hand that which he brought! By the life of Yahweh verily I will run after him, and accept of him something.
content_old: 20 Gehazi､ the servant of Elisha the man of God said— Lo! my lord hath restrained this Naaman the Syrian, by not taking at his hand that which he brought! By the life of Yahweh verily I will run after him, and accept of him something.

content: 21 So Gehazi hastened after Naaman. And when Naaman saw one running after him he alighted from his chariot to meet him､ and said,— Is all well?
content_old: 21 So Gehazi hastened after Naaman. And when Naaman saw one running after him he alighted from his chariot to meet him､ and said,— Is all well?

content: 22 And he said, All is well. My lord hath sent me to say, Lo! just now have come unto me､ two young men out of the hill country of Ephraim､ of the sons of the prophets,—give for them､ I pray thee､ a talent of silver, and two changes of raiment.
content_old: 22 And he said, All is well. My lord hath sent me to say, Lo! just now have come unto me､ two young men out of the hill country of Ephraim､ of the sons of the prophets,—give for them､ I pray thee､ a talent of silver, and two changes of raiment.

content: 23 And Naaman said, Be content､ accept two talents. So he urged him, and bound up two talents of silver in two bags､ and two changes of raiment, and laid them upon two of his young men, and they bare them before him.
content_old: 23 And Naaman said, Be content､ accept two talents. So he urged him, and bound up two talents of silver in two bags､ and two changes of raiment, and laid them upon two of his young men, and they bare them before him.

content: 24 And when he came to the hill-tower he took them from their hand､ and put them in charge within,—and let the men go､ and they departed.
content_old: 24 And when he came to the hill-tower he took them from their hand､ and put them in charge within,—and let the men go､ and they departed.

content: 25 Now when he came in and stood before his lord Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou Gehazi? And he said— Thy servant hath been neither hither nor thither.
content_old: 25 Now when he came in and stood before his lord Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou Gehazi? And he said— Thy servant hath been neither hither nor thither.

content: 26 Then he said unto him— My heart had not gone with thee, when someone turned again from off his chariot､ to meet thee! Is it a time to accept silver､ or to accept raiment, or oliveyards､ or vineyards､ or flocks or herds, or men-servants､ or maid-servants?
content_old: 26 Then he said unto him— My heart had not gone with thee, when someone turned again from off his chariot､ to meet thee! Is it a time to accept silver､ or to accept raiment, or oliveyards､ or vineyards､ or flocks or herds, or men-servants､ or maid-servants?

content: 1 And the sons of the prophets said unto Elisha,— See､ we pray thee､ the place wherein we sit before thee is too strait for us.
content_old: 1 And the sons of the prophets said unto Elisha,— See､ we pray thee､ the place wherein we sit before thee is too strait for us.

content: 2 Let us go､ we pray thee､ as far as the Jordan､ and fetch from thence every man a single beam, and let us make us a place wherein we may sit. And he said— Go ye.
content_old: 2 Let us go､ we pray thee､ as far as the Jordan､ and fetch from thence every man a single beam, and let us make us a place wherein we may sit. And he said— Go ye.

content: 3 Then said one— Be content､ we pray thee､ and go with thy servants. And he said— I myself will go.
content_old: 3 Then said one— Be content､ we pray thee､ and go with thy servants. And he said— I myself will go.

content: 4 So he went with them,—and when they came to the Jordan they cut down wood.
content_old: 4 So he went with them,—and when they came to the Jordan they cut down wood.

content: 5 And it came to pass as one was felling a branch that the axe-head fell into the water, so he made outcry and said— Alas! my lord､ for it was borrowed!
content_old: 5 And it came to pass as one was felling a branch that the axe-head fell into the water, so he made outcry and said— Alas! my lord､ for it was borrowed!

content: 6 And the man of God said— Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a piece of wood and cast it in thither, and the iron did swim.
content_old: 6 And the man of God said— Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a piece of wood and cast it in thither, and the iron did swim.

content: 7 And he said— Take it up to thee. So he put forth his hand､ and took it.
content_old: 7 And he said— Take it up to thee. So he put forth his hand､ and took it.

content: 8 Now the king of Syria was making war against Israel,—so he took counsel with his servants､ saying— In such and such a place shall be my encampment.
content_old: 8 Now the king of Syria was making war against Israel,—so he took counsel with his servants､ saying— In such and such a place shall be my encampment.

content: 9 The man of God､ therefore､ sent unto the king of Israel､ saying— Beware of passing by this place,—for thither are the Syrians coming down.
content_old: 9 The man of God､ therefore､ sent unto the king of Israel､ saying— Beware of passing by this place,—for thither are the Syrians coming down.

content: 10 So the king of Israel sent unto the place whereof the man of God had spoken to him and warned him､ and was on his guard there,—not once nor twice.
content_old: 10 So the king of Israel sent unto the place whereof the man of God had spoken to him and warned him､ and was on his guard there,—not once nor twice.

content: 11 Then was the heart of the king of Syria disquieted concerning this thing,—and he called his servants､ and said unto them, Will ye not tell me, who of our men are for the king of Israel?
content_old: 11 Then was the heart of the king of Syria disquieted concerning this thing,—and he called his servants､ and said unto them, Will ye not tell me, who of our men are for the king of Israel?

content: 12 Then said one of his servants, None､ my lord O king,—but Elisha､ the prophet､ who is in Israel telleth the king of Israel the words which thou speakest in thy bed-chamber.
content_old: 12 Then said one of his servants, None､ my lord O king,—but Elisha､ the prophet､ who is in Israel telleth the king of Israel the words which thou speakest in thy bed-chamber.

content: 13 And he said— Go､ and see where he is, that I may send and take him. And it was told him､ saying— Lo! in Dothan.
content_old: 13 And he said— Go､ and see where he is, that I may send and take him. And it was told him､ saying— Lo! in Dothan.

content: 14 Therefore sent he thither—horses and chariots､ and a strong force,—and they came in by night, and encompassed the city.
content_old: 14 Therefore sent he thither—horses and chariots､ and a strong force,—and they came in by night, and encompassed the city.

content: 15 And when the attendant of the man of God arose early and went forth lo! a force surrounding the city､ with horses and chariots. Then said his young man unto him— Alas! my lord､ what shall we do?
content_old: 15 And when the attendant of the man of God arose early and went forth lo! a force surrounding the city､ with horses and chariots. Then said his young man unto him— Alas! my lord､ what shall we do?

content: 16 And he said— Do not fear,—for more are they who are with us than they who are with them.
content_old: 16 And he said— Do not fear,—for more are they who are with us than they who are with them.

content: 17 Then prayed Elisha､ and said, O Yahweh! open､ I beseech thee､ his eyes､ that he may see. And Yahweh opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw､ and lo! the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire､ round about Elisha.
content_old: 17 Then prayed Elisha､ and said, O Yahweh! open､ I beseech thee､ his eyes､ that he may see. And Yahweh opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw､ and lo! the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire､ round about Elisha.

content: 18 And when they came down to him Elisha prayed unto Yahweh､ and said— Smite､ I beseech thee､ this people､ with sudden blindness. And he smote them with sudden blindness､ according to the word of Elisha.
content_old: 18 And when they came down to him Elisha prayed unto Yahweh､ and said— Smite､ I beseech thee､ this people､ with sudden blindness. And he smote them with sudden blindness､ according to the word of Elisha.

content: 19 Then Elisha said unto them— This is not the way､ neither is this the city, follow me, that I may lead you unto the man､ whom ye would secure! So he led them to Samaria.
content_old: 19 Then Elisha said unto them— This is not the way､ neither is this the city, follow me, that I may lead you unto the man､ whom ye would secure! So he led them to Samaria.

content: 20 And it came to pass when they had entered Samaria that Elisha said, O Yahweh! open the eyes of these men､ that they may see! And Yahweh opened their eyes, and they saw､ and lo! they were in the midst of Samaria!
content_old: 20 And it came to pass when they had entered Samaria that Elisha said, O Yahweh! open the eyes of these men､ that they may see! And Yahweh opened their eyes, and they saw､ and lo! they were in the midst of Samaria!

content: 21 Then said the king of Israel unto Elisha､ when he saw them,— Shall I smite—shall I smite､ my father?
content_old: 21 Then said the king of Israel unto Elisha､ when he saw them,— Shall I smite—shall I smite､ my father?

content: 22 And he said— Thou shalt not smite. Them whom thou hadst taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow wouldst thou have been smiting? Set bread and water before them､ that they may eat and drink, and go their way unto their lord.
content_old: 22 And he said— Thou shalt not smite. Them whom thou hadst taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow wouldst thou have been smiting? Set bread and water before them､ that they may eat and drink, and go their way unto their lord.

content: 23 And he made for them a great feast､and when they had eaten and drunk he let them go, and they went their way unto their lord. So then, troops of Syrians came again no more into the land of Israel.
content_old: 23 And he made for them a great feast､and when they had eaten and drunk he let them go, and they went their way unto their lord. So then, troops of Syrians came again no more into the land of Israel.

content: 24 But it came to pass after this that Benhadad king of Syria gathered together all his host,—and came up and laid siege against Samaria.
content_old: 24 But it came to pass after this that Benhadad king of Syria gathered together all his host,—and came up and laid siege against Samaria.

content: 25 And there came to be a great famine in Samaria, and lo! they continued the siege against it,—until an ass’s head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and one pint of dove’s dung for five pieces of silver.
content_old: 25 And there came to be a great famine in Samaria, and lo! they continued the siege against it,—until an ass’s head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and one pint of dove’s dung for five pieces of silver.

content: 26 And so it was that as the king of Israel was passing by on the wall a woman made outcry unto him､ saying— Save､ my lord､ O king!
content_old: 26 And so it was that as the king of Israel was passing by on the wall a woman made outcry unto him､ saying— Save､ my lord､ O king!

content: 27 And he said— If Yahweh do not save thee whence should I save thee? out of the threshing-floor or out of the wine-press?
content_old: 27 And he said— If Yahweh do not save thee whence should I save thee? out of the threshing-floor or out of the wine-press?

content: 28 And the king said to her— What aileth thee? And she said— This woman said unto me— Give thy son､ that we may eat him､ to-day, and my son will we eat to-morrow.
content_old: 28 And the king said to her— What aileth thee? And she said— This woman said unto me— Give thy son､ that we may eat him､ to-day, and my son will we eat to-morrow.

content: 29 So we cooked my son､ and did eat him,—and I said unto her､ on the next day､. Give thy son､ that we may eat him; But she had hid her son.
content_old: 29 So we cooked my son､ and did eat him,—and I said unto her､ on the next day､. Give thy son､ that we may eat him; But she had hid her son.

content: 30 And it came to pass when the king heard the words of the woman that he rent his clothes, while yet he was passing by upon the wall,—so the people looked, and lo! sackcloth upon his flesh､ within
content_old: 30 And it came to pass when the king heard the words of the woman that he rent his clothes, while yet he was passing by upon the wall,—so the people looked, and lo! sackcloth upon his flesh､ within

content: 31 And he said— So let God do to me､ and so let him add,—if the head of Elisha son of Shaphat remain on him､ to-day!
content_old: 31 And he said— So let God do to me､ and so let him add,—if the head of Elisha son of Shaphat remain on him､ to-day!

content: 32 Now Elisha being seated in his house, and the elders seated with him,—when he had sent a man from before him､ ere yet the messenger could could come in unto him he himself said unto the elders— Do ye see how this son of a murderer hath sent to take away my head? See! when the messenger is coming in close ye the door､ and press him back with the door, is not the sound of his lord’s feet behind him?
content_old: 32 Now Elisha being seated in his house, and the elders seated with him,—when he had sent a man from before him､ ere yet the messenger could could come in unto him he himself said unto the elders— Do ye see how this son of a murderer hath sent to take away my head? See! when the messenger is coming in close ye the door､ and press him back with the door, is not the sound of his lord’s feet behind him?

content: 1 Then said Elisha— Hear ye the word of Yahweh,— Thus saith Yahweh— About this time to-morrow A measure of fine meal for a shekel, And two measures of barley for a shekel､ in the gate of Samaria.
content_old: 1 Then said Elisha— Hear ye the word of Yahweh,— Thus saith Yahweh— About this time to-morrow A measure of fine meal for a shekel, And two measures of barley for a shekel､ in the gate of Samaria.

content: 2 Then the officer on whose hand the king leaned responded to the man of God､ and said, Even if Yahweh were making windows in the heavens could this thing come to pass? And he said— Lo! thou art about to see it with thine own eyes, but thereof shalt thou not eat!
content_old: 2 Then the officer on whose hand the king leaned responded to the man of God､ and said, Even if Yahweh were making windows in the heavens could this thing come to pass? And he said— Lo! thou art about to see it with thine own eyes, but thereof shalt thou not eat!

content: 3 Now there were four men lepers､ at the entrance of the gate,—and they said one to another— Why are we sitting here until we are dead?
content_old: 3 Now there were four men lepers､ at the entrance of the gate,—and they said one to another— Why are we sitting here until we are dead?

content: 4 If we say— Let us enter into the city, Then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there, and if we remain here then shall we die. Now therefore､ let us fall away unto the camp of the Syrians, if they save us alive we shall live, and if they put us to death we shall die.
content_old: 4 If we say— Let us enter into the city, Then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there, and if we remain here then shall we die. Now therefore､ let us fall away unto the camp of the Syrians, if they save us alive we shall live, and if they put us to death we shall die.

content: 5 So they rose up in the twilight, to enter into the camp of the Syrians,—and when they entered the outskirts of the camp of the Syrians lo! there was not there a man.
content_old: 5 So they rose up in the twilight, to enter into the camp of the Syrians,—and when they entered the outskirts of the camp of the Syrians lo! there was not there a man.

content: 6 Now the Lord had caused the camp of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots､ a noise of horses, a noise of a great host,—and they said one to another— Lo! the king of Israel hath hired against us—the kings of the Hittites､ and the kings of the Egyptians､ to come against us.
content_old: 6 Now the Lord had caused the camp of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots､ a noise of horses, a noise of a great host,—and they said one to another— Lo! the king of Israel hath hired against us—the kings of the Hittites､ and the kings of the Egyptians､ to come against us.

content: 7 So they arose､ and fled in the twilight, and left their tents､ and their horses､ and-their asses,—the camp､ just as it was,—and fled for their lives.
content_old: 7 So they arose､ and fled in the twilight, and left their tents､ and their horses､ and-their asses,—the camp､ just as it was,—and fled for their lives.

content: 8 When､ therefore､ these lepers came in as far as the outskirts of the camp they entered into one tent､ and did eat and drink, and carried from thence silver､ and gold､ and raiment, and went away and hid them,—and came again､ and entered into another tent, and carried from thence—and went and hid them.
content_old: 8 When､ therefore､ these lepers came in as far as the outskirts of the camp they entered into one tent､ and did eat and drink, and carried from thence silver､ and gold､ and raiment, and went away and hid them,—and came again､ and entered into another tent, and carried from thence—and went and hid them.

content: 9 Then said they one to another— Not a right thing are we doing､ This day is a day of good tidings and we are holding our peace､ if we tarry until the light of the morning there will come upon us some misfortune,— Now therefore､ come and let us go in, and tell the household of the king.
content_old: 9 Then said they one to another— Not a right thing are we doing､ This day is a day of good tidings and we are holding our peace､ if we tarry until the light of the morning there will come upon us some misfortune,— Now therefore､ come and let us go in, and tell the household of the king.

content: 10 So they came in and called unto the gate of the city, and told them､ saying, We entered into the camp of the Syrians, and lo! there was not there a man nor sound of human being,—only horses tied､ and asses tied, and their tents､ just as they were!
content_old: 10 So they came in and called unto the gate of the city, and told them､ saying, We entered into the camp of the Syrians, and lo! there was not there a man nor sound of human being,—only horses tied､ and asses tied, and their tents､ just as they were!

content: 11 And the watchers of the gate called and told it to the house hold of the king within.
content_old: 11 And the watchers of the gate called and told it to the house hold of the king within.

content: 12 Then arose the king by night､ and said unto his servants, Let me tell you､ I pray you､ what the Syrians have done to us,—they knew that we were famished､ so they have gone forth out of the camp､ to hide in the field､ saying, When they come forth out of the city then shall we take them alive, and into the city will we enter.
content_old: 12 Then arose the king by night､ and said unto his servants, Let me tell you､ I pray you､ what the Syrians have done to us,—they knew that we were famished､ so they have gone forth out of the camp､ to hide in the field､ saying, When they come forth out of the city then shall we take them alive, and into the city will we enter.

content: 13 Then responded one of his servants､ and said— Let there be taken､ I pray thee､ five of the horses that remain､ which have been left therein, there they are according to all the multitude of Israel who have been left therein there they are according to all the multitude of Israel who have been consumed,—and let us send and see!
content_old: 13 Then responded one of his servants､ and said— Let there be taken､ I pray thee､ five of the horses that remain､ which have been left therein, there they are according to all the multitude of Israel who have been left therein there they are according to all the multitude of Israel who have been consumed,—and let us send and see!

content: 14 So they took two chariots and horses,—and the king sent after the host of the Syrians､ saying､ Go and see!
content_old: 14 So they took two chariots and horses,—and the king sent after the host of the Syrians､ saying､ Go and see!

content: 15 And they followed them as far as the Jordan, and lo! all the way was full of garments､ and utensils, which the Syrians had cast away in their fright,—and the messengers returned, and told the king.
content_old: 15 And they followed them as far as the Jordan, and lo! all the way was full of garments､ and utensils, which the Syrians had cast away in their fright,—and the messengers returned, and told the king.

content: 16 Then went the people forth and spoiled the camp of the Syrians,—and so there came to be— A measure of fine meal for a shekel､ And two measures of barley for a shekel､ according to the word of Yahweh.
content_old: 16 Then went the people forth and spoiled the camp of the Syrians,—and so there came to be— A measure of fine meal for a shekel､ And two measures of barley for a shekel､ according to the word of Yahweh.

content: 17 Now the king had set the officer on whose hand he leaned､ in charge over the gate, and the people trode upon him in the gate､ that he died,—as spake the man of God､ who said it when the messenger､ came down to him.
content_old: 17 Now the king had set the officer on whose hand he leaned､ in charge over the gate, and the people trode upon him in the gate､ that he died,—as spake the man of God､ who said it when the messenger､ came down to him.

content: 18 Yea it came to pass as the man of God had spoken unto the messenger saying,— Two measures of barley for a shekel､ And a measure of fine meal for a shekel, shall there be about this time to-morrow, in the gate of Samaria:
content_old: 18 Yea it came to pass as the man of God had spoken unto the messenger saying,— Two measures of barley for a shekel､ And a measure of fine meal for a shekel, shall there be about this time to-morrow, in the gate of Samaria:

content: 19 And when the officer responded to the man of God and said, Lo! then if Yahweh were making windows in the heavens, could it be according to this word? And he said,— Lo! thou art about to see it with thine own eyes, but thereof shalt thou not eat
content_old: 19 And when the officer responded to the man of God and said, Lo! then if Yahweh were making windows in the heavens, could it be according to this word? And he said,— Lo! thou art about to see it with thine own eyes, but thereof shalt thou not eat

content: 1 Now Elisha had spoken unto the woman whose son he had restored to life､ saying— Arise､ and take thy journey､ thou and thy household, and sojourn wheresoever thou canst sojourn,—for Yahweh hath called for a famine, moreover also it is coming upon the land seven years.
content_old: 1 Now Elisha had spoken unto the woman whose son he had restored to life､ saying— Arise､ and take thy journey､ thou and thy household, and sojourn wheresoever thou canst sojourn,—for Yahweh hath called for a famine, moreover also it is coming upon the land seven years.

content: 2 So the woman arose, and did according to the word of the man of God,—and took her journey she and her household and she sojourned in the land of the Philistines､ seven years.
content_old: 2 So the woman arose, and did according to the word of the man of God,—and took her journey she and her household and she sojourned in the land of the Philistines､ seven years.

content: 3 And it came to pass at the end of seven years that the woman returned out of the land of the Philistines,—and she went forth to make outcry unto the king, concerning her house and concerning her field.
content_old: 3 And it came to pass at the end of seven years that the woman returned out of the land of the Philistines,—and she went forth to make outcry unto the king, concerning her house and concerning her field.

content: 4 Now the king was speaking unto Gehazi, servant of the man of God､ saying,— Do recount unto me､ I pray thee､ all the great things that Elisha hath done.
content_old: 4 Now the king was speaking unto Gehazi, servant of the man of God､ saying,— Do recount unto me､ I pray thee､ all the great things that Elisha hath done.

content: 5 And so it was just as he was recounting to the king how he had restored the dead to life lo! the woman whose son he had restored to life began making outery unto the king, for her house and for her field. Then said Gehazi, My lord､ O king! this is the woman, and this her son､ whom Elisha restored to life.
content_old: 5 And so it was just as he was recounting to the king how he had restored the dead to life lo! the woman whose son he had restored to life began making outery unto the king, for her house and for her field. Then said Gehazi, My lord､ O king! this is the woman, and this her son､ whom Elisha restored to life.

content: 6 So the king asked the woman､ and she recounted it to him,—the king､ therefore､ appointed her a certain officer､ saying— Restore all that was hers､ and all the increase of the field, from the day she left the land､ even until now.
content_old: 6 So the king asked the woman､ and she recounted it to him,—the king､ therefore､ appointed her a certain officer､ saying— Restore all that was hers､ and all the increase of the field, from the day she left the land､ even until now.

content: 7 And Elisha came into Damascus, when Ben-hadad king of Syria was sick,—and it was told him､ saying, The man of God hath come as far as this place.
content_old: 7 And Elisha came into Damascus, when Ben-hadad king of Syria was sick,—and it was told him､ saying, The man of God hath come as far as this place.

content: 8 So the king said unto Hazael— Take in thy hand a present, and go to meet the man of God,—so shalt thou enquire of Yahweh､ from him､ saying, Shall I recover from this sickness?
content_old: 8 So the king said unto Hazael— Take in thy hand a present, and go to meet the man of God,—so shalt thou enquire of Yahweh､ from him､ saying, Shall I recover from this sickness?

content: 9 So Hazael went to meet him, and took a present in his hand､ even every good thing of Damascus, forty camels burden,—and came､ and stood before him, and said— Thy son､ Ben-hadad king of Syria hath sent me unto thee､ saying, Shall I recover from this sickness?
content_old: 9 So Hazael went to meet him, and took a present in his hand､ even every good thing of Damascus, forty camels burden,—and came､ and stood before him, and said— Thy son､ Ben-hadad king of Syria hath sent me unto thee､ saying, Shall I recover from this sickness?

content: 10 And Elisha said unto him, Go, say to him, Thou shalt recover; And yet Yahweh hath shown me､ that he will die.
content_old: 10 And Elisha said unto him, Go, say to him, Thou shalt recover; And yet Yahweh hath shown me､ that he will die.

content: 11 And he settled his countenance､ and fixed it until he turned pale,—and the man of God wept.
content_old: 11 And he settled his countenance､ and fixed it until he turned pale,—and the man of God wept.

content: 12 Then said Hazael, Why is my lord weeping? And he said— Because I know what thou wilt do to the sons of Israel､ by way of harm— Their fortresses thou wilt set on fire､ And their choice young men with the sword thou wilt slay, And their children thou wilt dash in pieces, And their women with child thou wilt rip up.
content_old: 12 Then said Hazael, Why is my lord weeping? And he said— Because I know what thou wilt do to the sons of Israel､ by way of harm— Their fortresses thou wilt set on fire､ And their choice young men with the sword thou wilt slay, And their children thou wilt dash in pieces, And their women with child thou wilt rip up.

content: 13 And Hazael said, But what is thy servant—the dog—that he should do this great thing? And Elisha said, Yahweh hath shown thee unto me､ as king over Syria.
content_old: 13 And Hazael said, But what is thy servant—the dog—that he should do this great thing? And Elisha said, Yahweh hath shown thee unto me､ as king over Syria.

content: 14 So he departed from Elisha､ and came in unto his lord, who said to him, What said Elisha unto thee? And he said､ He told me thou wouldst recover.
content_old: 14 So he departed from Elisha､ and came in unto his lord, who said to him, What said Elisha unto thee? And he said､ He told me thou wouldst recover.

content: 15 But it came to pass on the morrow, that he took the coverlet､ and dipped it in water, and spread it over his face､ that he died､—and Hazael reigned in his stead.
content_old: 15 But it came to pass on the morrow, that he took the coverlet､ and dipped it in water, and spread it over his face､ that he died､—and Hazael reigned in his stead.

content: 16 Now in the fifth year of Joram son of Ahab､ king of Israel, Jehoshaphat having been king of Judah Jehoram､ son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah､ began to reign.
content_old: 16 Now in the fifth year of Joram son of Ahab､ king of Israel, Jehoshaphat having been king of Judah Jehoram､ son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah､ began to reign.

content: 17 Thirty-two years old was he when he began to reign, and eight years reigned､ he in Jerusalem.
content_old: 17 Thirty-two years old was he when he began to reign, and eight years reigned､ he in Jerusalem.

content: 18 And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel､ just as did the house of Ahab, for a daughter of Ahab became his wife,—and he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh.
content_old: 18 And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel､ just as did the house of Ahab, for a daughter of Ahab became his wife,—and he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh.

content: 19 Yet was not Yahweh willing to destroy Judah, for the sake of David his servant,—even as he promised him to give him a lamp for his sons all the days.
content_old: 19 Yet was not Yahweh willing to destroy Judah, for the sake of David his servant,—even as he promised him to give him a lamp for his sons all the days.

content: 20 In his days did Edom revolt from under the hand of Judah,—and they set over them a king.
content_old: 20 In his days did Edom revolt from under the hand of Judah,—and they set over them a king.

content: 21 So Joram passed over to Zair, and all the chariots with him,—and it came to pass that he arising by night､ smote the Edomites that were round about unto him､ and the captains of the chariots, and the people fled to their homes.
content_old: 21 So Joram passed over to Zair, and all the chariots with him,—and it came to pass that he arising by night､ smote the Edomites that were round about unto him､ and the captains of the chariots, and the people fled to their homes.

content: 22 Yet did Edom revolt from under the hand of Judah, unto this day,—then revolted Libnah at the same time.
content_old: 22 Yet did Edom revolt from under the hand of Judah, unto this day,—then revolted Libnah at the same time.

content: 23 Now the rest of the story of Joram, and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 23 Now the rest of the story of Joram, and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 24 And Joram slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers､ in the city of David,—and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 24 And Joram slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers､ in the city of David,—and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.

content: 25 In the twelfth year of Joram son of Ahab king of Israel did Ahaziah son of Jehoram king of Judah､ begin to reign.
