content_old: 25 In the twelfth year of Joram son of Ahab king of Israel did Ahaziah son of Jehoram king of Judah､ begin to reign.

content: 26 Two and twenty years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign,—and one year reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Athaliah, daughter of Omri､ king of Israel.
content_old: 26 Two and twenty years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign,—and one year reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Athaliah, daughter of Omri､ king of Israel.

content: 27 And he walked in the way of the house of Ahab, and did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ like the house of Ahab,—for son-in-law of the house of Ahab was he.
content_old: 27 And he walked in the way of the house of Ahab, and did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ like the house of Ahab,—for son-in-law of the house of Ahab was he.

content: 28 And he went with Joram son of Ahab､ to make war against Hazael king of Syria､ in Ramoth-gilead,—and the Syrians wounded Joram.
content_old: 28 And he went with Joram son of Ahab､ to make war against Hazael king of Syria､ in Ramoth-gilead,—and the Syrians wounded Joram.

content: 1 Now Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets,—and said to him— Gird up thy loins､ and take this flask of oil in thy hand, and go to Ramoth-gilead;
content_old: 1 Now Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets,—and said to him— Gird up thy loins､ and take this flask of oil in thy hand, and go to Ramoth-gilead;

content: 2 and when thou art come in thither then look thee out､ there､ Jehu son of Jehoshaphat､ son of Nimshi; and thou shalt enter and get him to rise up out of the midst of his brethren, and take him into an inner chamber;
content_old: 2 and when thou art come in thither then look thee out､ there､ Jehu son of Jehoshaphat､ son of Nimshi; and thou shalt enter and get him to rise up out of the midst of his brethren, and take him into an inner chamber;

content: 3 then shalt thou take the flask of oil､ and pour out upon his head, and say— Thus saith Yahweh, I have anointed thee to be king unto Israel! Then shalt thou open the door and flee､ and not tarry.
content_old: 3 then shalt thou take the flask of oil､ and pour out upon his head, and say— Thus saith Yahweh, I have anointed thee to be king unto Israel! Then shalt thou open the door and flee､ and not tarry.

content: 4 So the young man went his way—the young man the prophet—unto Ramoth-gilead.
content_old: 4 So the young man went his way—the young man the prophet—unto Ramoth-gilead.

content: 5 And when he came up lo! the captains of the force sitting, and he said— A word have I､ for thee､ O captain! And Jehu said— For which､ of us all? And he said— For thee､ O captain!
content_old: 5 And when he came up lo! the captains of the force sitting, and he said— A word have I､ for thee､ O captain! And Jehu said— For which､ of us all? And he said— For thee､ O captain!

content: 6 Then rose he up and went inside, and poured out the oil upon his head,—and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, I have anointed thee to be king unto the people of Yahweh､ unto Israel;
content_old: 6 Then rose he up and went inside, and poured out the oil upon his head,—and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, I have anointed thee to be king unto the people of Yahweh､ unto Israel;

content: 7 and thou shalt smite the house of Ahab thy lord,—so will I avenge the blood of my servants the prophets､ and the blood of all the servants of Yahweh､ at the hand of Jezebel;
content_old: 7 and thou shalt smite the house of Ahab thy lord,—so will I avenge the blood of my servants the prophets､ and the blood of all the servants of Yahweh､ at the hand of Jezebel;

content: 8 so shall perish all the house of Ahab,—and I will cut off to Ahab the meanest, both him that is shut up and him that is left at large､ in Israel.
content_old: 8 so shall perish all the house of Ahab,—and I will cut off to Ahab the meanest, both him that is shut up and him that is left at large､ in Israel.

content: 9 Yea I will deliver up the house of Ahab, Like the house of Jeroboam son of Nebat,—And like the house of Baasha son of Ahijah:
content_old: 9 Yea I will deliver up the house of Ahab, Like the house of Jeroboam son of Nebat,—And like the house of Baasha son of Ahijah:

content: 10 And as for Jezebel the dogs shall eat her ､ in the town-land of Jezreel､ there being none to bury her. And he opened the door､ and fled.
content_old: 10 And as for Jezebel the dogs shall eat her ､ in the town-land of Jezreel､ there being none to bury her. And he opened the door､ and fled.

content: 11 Then Jehu came forth unto the servants of his lord, and one said to him— Is all well? why came this madman unto thee? And he said unto them, Ye know､ the man and his message.
content_old: 11 Then Jehu came forth unto the servants of his lord, and one said to him— Is all well? why came this madman unto thee? And he said unto them, Ye know､ the man and his message.

content: 12 And they said— False! pray tell us. And he said— Thus and thus spake he unto me､ saying, Thus saith Yahweh, I have anointed thee to be king unto Israel.
content_old: 12 And they said— False! pray tell us. And he said— Thus and thus spake he unto me､ saying, Thus saith Yahweh, I have anointed thee to be king unto Israel.

content: 13 Then hasted they､ and took､ every man his garment, and put it under him､ upon the very steps,—and blew with a horn, and said､ Jehu is king!
content_old: 13 Then hasted they､ and took､ every man his garment, and put it under him､ upon the very steps,—and blew with a horn, and said､ Jehu is king!

content: 14 Thus did Jehu son of Jehoshaphat son of Nimshi conspire against Joram,—when Joram was watching Ramoth-gilead, he and all Israel because of Hazael king of Syria.
content_old: 14 Thus did Jehu son of Jehoshaphat son of Nimshi conspire against Joram,—when Joram was watching Ramoth-gilead, he and all Israel because of Hazael king of Syria.

content: 15 But Jehoram the king had returned to get himself healed in Jezreel､ of the wounds wherewith the Syrians had wounded him, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria. Then said Jehu— If such is your mind let no fugitive get forth out of the city, to go and tell it in Jezreel.
content_old: 15 But Jehoram the king had returned to get himself healed in Jezreel､ of the wounds wherewith the Syrians had wounded him, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria. Then said Jehu— If such is your mind let no fugitive get forth out of the city, to go and tell it in Jezreel.

content: 16 So Jehu rode in a chariot, and went towards Jezreel, for Joram was lying there,—and Ahaziah king of Judah had come down to see Joram.
content_old: 16 So Jehu rode in a chariot, and went towards Jezreel, for Joram was lying there,—and Ahaziah king of Judah had come down to see Joram.

content: 17 Now the watchman was standing upon the tower､ in Jezreel, so he saw the great company of Jehu､ when he came, and said— A great company can Isee! Then said Jehoram— Take a horseman and send to meet them､ that he may say— Is it peace?
content_old: 17 Now the watchman was standing upon the tower､ in Jezreel, so he saw the great company of Jehu､ when he came, and said— A great company can Isee! Then said Jehoram— Take a horseman and send to meet them､ that he may say— Is it peace?

content: 18 So the horseman went to meet him､ and said— Thus saith the king､ Is it peace? And Jehu said— What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me. And the watchman told､ saying, The messenger came up to them､ but hath not turned back.
content_old: 18 So the horseman went to meet him､ and said— Thus saith the king､ Is it peace? And Jehu said— What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me. And the watchman told､ saying, The messenger came up to them､ but hath not turned back.

content: 19 Then sent he a second horseman, and he came up to them and said､ Thus saith the king Is it peace? And Jehu said— What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.
content_old: 19 Then sent he a second horseman, and he came up to them and said､ Thus saith the king Is it peace? And Jehu said— What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.

content: 20 And the watchman told､ saying, He came up to them､ but hath not turned back,—and the driving is like the driving of Jehu son of Nimshi; for with mad haste doth he drive.
content_old: 20 And the watchman told､ saying, He came up to them､ but hath not turned back,—and the driving is like the driving of Jehu son of Nimshi; for with mad haste doth he drive.

content: 21 Then said Jehoram､ Harness! So one harnessed his chariot,—and Jehoram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went forth､ each man in his chariot､ yea they went forth to meet Jehu, and came upon him in the heritage of Naboth the Jezreelite.
content_old: 21 Then said Jehoram､ Harness! So one harnessed his chariot,—and Jehoram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went forth､ each man in his chariot､ yea they went forth to meet Jehu, and came upon him in the heritage of Naboth the Jezreelite.

content: 22 And it came to pass when Jehoram saw Jehu that he said— Is it peace､ Jehu? And he said— What can be the peace, while thy mother Jezebel’s harlotries and her incantations do so abound?
content_old: 22 And it came to pass when Jehoram saw Jehu that he said— Is it peace､ Jehu? And he said— What can be the peace, while thy mother Jezebel’s harlotries and her incantations do so abound?

content: 23 Then Jehoram turned his hands､ and fled,—and said unto Ahaziah— Treachery! O Ahaziah!
content_old: 23 Then Jehoram turned his hands､ and fled,—and said unto Ahaziah— Treachery! O Ahaziah!

content: 24 And Jehu bent his bow､ and smote Jehoram､ between his arms,—and the arrow came out at his heart,—and he sank down in his chariot.
content_old: 24 And Jehu bent his bow､ and smote Jehoram､ between his arms,—and the arrow came out at his heart,—and he sank down in his chariot.

content: 25 Then said he unto Bidkar his officer, Take him up､ and cast him forth, into the field-portion of Naboth the Jezreelite,—for remember when I and thou were riding as a couple together after Ahab his father that Yahweh laid upon him this doom:
content_old: 25 Then said he unto Bidkar his officer, Take him up､ and cast him forth, into the field-portion of Naboth the Jezreelite,—for remember when I and thou were riding as a couple together after Ahab his father that Yahweh laid upon him this doom:

content: 26 Surely the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons have I lately seen､ Declareth Yahweh, Therefore will I requite thee in this portion､ Declareth Yahweh. Now therefore､ take him up､ and cast him forth into the portion､ according to the word of Yahweh.
content_old: 26 Surely the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons have I lately seen､ Declareth Yahweh, Therefore will I requite thee in this portion､ Declareth Yahweh. Now therefore､ take him up､ and cast him forth into the portion､ according to the word of Yahweh.

content: 27 And Ahaziah king of Judah saw it, and fled by the way of the garden house,—and Jehu pursued him､ and said— Him also! smite him in the chariot! It was in the ascent of Gur､ which is by Ibleam. And he fled to Mepidgo､ and died there.
content_old: 27 And Ahaziah king of Judah saw it, and fled by the way of the garden house,—and Jehu pursued him､ and said— Him also! smite him in the chariot! It was in the ascent of Gur､ which is by Ibleam. And he fled to Mepidgo､ and died there.

content: 28 And his servants conveyed him in a chariot and brought him into Jerusalem,—and buried him in his sepulchre､ with his fathers､ in the city of David.
content_old: 28 And his servants conveyed him in a chariot and brought him into Jerusalem,—and buried him in his sepulchre､ with his fathers､ in the city of David.

content: 29 Now it was in the eleventh year of Joram son of Ahab that Ahaziah began to reign over Judah.
content_old: 29 Now it was in the eleventh year of Joram son of Ahab that Ahaziah began to reign over Judah.

content: 30 Now when Jehu entered Jezreel and Jezebel heard of it she set her eyes in stibium､ and ornamented her head, and looked forth through the lattice.
content_old: 30 Now when Jehu entered Jezreel and Jezebel heard of it she set her eyes in stibium､ and ornamented her head, and looked forth through the lattice.

content: 31 So when Jehu had entered in at the gate she said, Was it peace, when Zimri slew his lord?
content_old: 31 So when Jehu had entered in at the gate she said, Was it peace, when Zimri slew his lord?

content: 32 And he lifted up his face unto the lattice, and said— Who is with me? Who? And there looked out unto him, two or three eunuchs.
content_old: 32 And he lifted up his face unto the lattice, and said— Who is with me? Who? And there looked out unto him, two or three eunuchs.

content: 33 And he said— Hurl her down. And they hurled her down,—and there was sprinkled of her blood—upon the wall､ and upon the horses､ and they trode upon her.
content_old: 33 And he said— Hurl her down. And they hurled her down,—and there was sprinkled of her blood—upon the wall､ and upon the horses､ and they trode upon her.

content: 34 And when he had entered and eaten and drunk he said— Look､ I pray you��� after this accursed woman､ and bury her, for the daughter of a king she is.
content_old: 34 And when he had entered and eaten and drunk he said— Look､ I pray you��� after this accursed woman､ and bury her, for the daughter of a king she is.

content: 35 So they went to bury her,—but found not of her—save the skull､ and the feet､ and the palms of the hands.
content_old: 35 So they went to bury her,—but found not of her—save the skull､ and the feet､ and the palms of the hands.

content: 36 Then came they back､ and told him, and he said— The word of Yahweh it is､ which he spake by the hand of his servant､ Elijah the Tishbite､ saying— In the town-land of Jezreel Shall dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel!
content_old: 36 Then came they back､ and told him, and he said— The word of Yahweh it is､ which he spake by the hand of his servant､ Elijah the Tishbite､ saying— In the town-land of Jezreel Shall dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel!

content: 1 Now Abab had seventy sons in Samaria,—so Jehu wrote letters､ and sent to Samaria､ unto the rulers of Jezreel—the elders, and unto them who had been foster-parents for Ahab､ saying:
content_old: 1 Now Abab had seventy sons in Samaria,—so Jehu wrote letters､ and sent to Samaria､ unto the rulers of Jezreel—the elders, and unto them who had been foster-parents for Ahab､ saying:

content: 2 Now therefore､ when this letter cometh in unto you, there being with you the sons of your lord,—and with you the chariots and the horses, and a fortified city､ and the armour
content_old: 2 Now therefore､ when this letter cometh in unto you, there being with you the sons of your lord,—and with you the chariots and the horses, and a fortified city､ and the armour

content: 3 ye shall look out the goodliest and fittest of the sons of your lord, and set on the throne of his father, and ye shall do battle for the house of your lord.
content_old: 3 ye shall look out the goodliest and fittest of the sons of your lord, and set on the throne of his father, and ye shall do battle for the house of your lord.

content: 4 Then feared they very greatly, and said, Lo! two kings stood not before him; how then should we stand?
content_old: 4 Then feared they very greatly, and said, Lo! two kings stood not before him; how then should we stand?

content: 5 So he that was over the house､ and he that was over the city､ and the elders､ and the foster-parents sent unto Jehu､ saying— Thy servants we are! And all that thou shalt say unto us will we do,— We will make no man king, Whatsoever is good in thine own eyes do!
content_old: 5 So he that was over the house､ and he that was over the city､ and the elders､ and the foster-parents sent unto Jehu､ saying— Thy servants we are! And all that thou shalt say unto us will we do,— We will make no man king, Whatsoever is good in thine own eyes do!

content: 6 Then wrote he unto them a second letter､ saying— If mine ye are､ and unto my voice ye intend to hearken take ye the heads of the men who are sons of your lord, and come in unto me about this time to-morrow､ in Jezreel. Now the sons of the king､ seventy persons were with the great men of the city､ who had been bringing them up.
content_old: 6 Then wrote he unto them a second letter､ saying— If mine ye are､ and unto my voice ye intend to hearken take ye the heads of the men who are sons of your lord, and come in unto me about this time to-morrow､ in Jezreel. Now the sons of the king､ seventy persons were with the great men of the city､ who had been bringing them up.

content: 7 And it came to pass when the letter reached them that they took the sons of the king, and slew them､ seventy persons,—and put their heads in baskets, and sent unto him､ to Jezreel.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass when the letter reached them that they took the sons of the king, and slew them､ seventy persons,—and put their heads in baskets, and sent unto him､ to Jezreel.

content: 8 And there came in a messenger and told him､ saying, They have brought in the heads of the sons of the king. And he said— Lay ye them in two heaps､ at the entrance of the gate､ until the morning.
content_old: 8 And there came in a messenger and told him､ saying, They have brought in the heads of the sons of the king. And he said— Lay ye them in two heaps､ at the entrance of the gate､ until the morning.

content: 9 And it came to pass in the morning that he went out and took his stand, and said unto all the people, Righteous are ye! Lo! I conspired against my lord､ and slew him, but who smote all these?
content_old: 9 And it came to pass in the morning that he went out and took his stand, and said unto all the people, Righteous are ye! Lo! I conspired against my lord､ and slew him, but who smote all these?

content: 10 Know ye､ then､ that there shall fall nought of the word of Yahweh､ to the ground, which Yahweh spake concerning the house of Ahab,—but Yahweh hath done that which he spake through his servant Elijah.
content_old: 10 Know ye､ then､ that there shall fall nought of the word of Yahweh､ to the ground, which Yahweh spake concerning the house of Ahab,—but Yahweh hath done that which he spake through his servant Elijah.

content: 11 Then Jehu smote all that were left remaining unto the house of Ahab､ in Jezreel, and all his great men､ and his acquaintances and his priests,—until there was not left remaining to him a survivor.
content_old: 11 Then Jehu smote all that were left remaining unto the house of Ahab､ in Jezreel, and all his great men､ and his acquaintances and his priests,—until there was not left remaining to him a survivor.

content: 12 Then arose he､ and came in, and departed for Samaria,—the sheep-shearing house itself being on the road;
content_old: 12 Then arose he､ and came in, and departed for Samaria,—the sheep-shearing house itself being on the road;

content: 13 so Jehu lighted upon the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said､— Who are ye? And they said— Brethren of Ahaziah are we; so we came down to salute the sons of the king､ and the sons of the queen.
content_old: 13 so Jehu lighted upon the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said､— Who are ye? And they said— Brethren of Ahaziah are we; so we came down to salute the sons of the king､ and the sons of the queen.

content: 14 Then said he— Take them alive. So they took them alive, and slew them casting them into the pit of the shearing house,—forty-two men, neither left he remaining a man of them.
content_old: 14 Then said he— Take them alive. So they took them alive, and slew them casting them into the pit of the shearing house,—forty-two men, neither left he remaining a man of them.

content: 15 Then departed he from thence､ and lighted on Jehonadab son of Rechab coming to meet him､ and he blessed him､ and said unto him— Is thy heart right､ as my heart is with thy heart? And Jehonadab said— It is. Then if it is give me thy hand. So he gave him his hand. And he took him､ up to him into the chariot;
content_old: 15 Then departed he from thence､ and lighted on Jehonadab son of Rechab coming to meet him､ and he blessed him､ and said unto him— Is thy heart right､ as my heart is with thy heart? And Jehonadab said— It is. Then if it is give me thy hand. So he gave him his hand. And he took him､ up to him into the chariot;

content: 16 and said—Do come with me, and see my jealousy for Yahweh. So he made him ride in his chariot.
content_old: 16 and said—Do come with me, and see my jealousy for Yahweh. So he made him ride in his chariot.

content: 17 And when he came into Samaria he smote all that were left remaining unto Ahab､ in Samaria､ until he had destroyed him,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he had spoken unto Elijah.
content_old: 17 And when he came into Samaria he smote all that were left remaining unto Ahab､ in Samaria､ until he had destroyed him,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he had spoken unto Elijah.

content: 18 Then Jehu gathered together all the people, and said unto them,— Ahab served Baal a little,—Jehu will serve him much.
content_old: 18 Then Jehu gathered together all the people, and said unto them,— Ahab served Baal a little,—Jehu will serve him much.

content: 19 Now､ therefore､ all the prophets of Baal､ all his servants and all his priests call ye unto me; do not let a man be missing; for a great sacrifice have I､ to Baal, no one that is missing shall live. But Jehu acted craftily to the end he might destroy the servants of Baal.
content_old: 19 Now､ therefore､ all the prophets of Baal､ all his servants and all his priests call ye unto me; do not let a man be missing; for a great sacrifice have I､ to Baal, no one that is missing shall live. But Jehu acted craftily to the end he might destroy the servants of Baal.

content: 20 And Jehu said､— Hallow ye a solemn festival unto Baal. And they made proclamation.
content_old: 20 And Jehu said､— Hallow ye a solemn festival unto Baal. And they made proclamation.

content: 21 And Jehu sent throughout all Israel, and all the servants of Baal came in, so that there was not left remaining a man､ who had not come in,—and they entered the house of Baal, and the house of Baal was filled､ from door to door.
content_old: 21 And Jehu sent throughout all Israel, and all the servants of Baal came in, so that there was not left remaining a man､ who had not come in,—and they entered the house of Baal, and the house of Baal was filled､ from door to door.

content: 22 Then said he to him who was over the wardrobe chamber, Bring forth vestments for all the servants of Baal. And he brought forth for them the vestments.
content_old: 22 Then said he to him who was over the wardrobe chamber, Bring forth vestments for all the servants of Baal. And he brought forth for them the vestments.

content: 23 Then entered Jehu､ with Jehonadab son of Rechab､ into the house of Baal,—and he said unto the servants of Baal— Search ye and see､ that there be not here､ with you､ any of the servants of Yahweh, none but the servants of Baal､ alone.
content_old: 23 Then entered Jehu､ with Jehonadab son of Rechab､ into the house of Baal,—and he said unto the servants of Baal— Search ye and see､ that there be not here､ with you､ any of the servants of Yahweh, none but the servants of Baal､ alone.

content: 24 And when they entered to offer sacrifices and ascending-offerings Jehu set him outside eighty men, and said— The man who shall escape､ of the men whom I am bringing into your power his own life shall be for his life.
content_old: 24 And when they entered to offer sacrifices and ascending-offerings Jehu set him outside eighty men, and said— The man who shall escape､ of the men whom I am bringing into your power his own life shall be for his life.

content: 25 And it came to pass as soon as he had made an end of offering the ascending-sacrifice that Jehu said to the runners and to the officers— Enter､ smite them､ let not a man get out. So they smote them､ with the edge of the sword,—and the runners and the officers cast them out, and then went as far as the city of the house of Baal,
content_old: 25 And it came to pass as soon as he had made an end of offering the ascending-sacrifice that Jehu said to the runners and to the officers— Enter､ smite them､ let not a man get out. So they smote them､ with the edge of the sword,—and the runners and the officers cast them out, and then went as far as the city of the house of Baal,

content: 26 and brought forth the idolatrous pillars that were in the house of Baal､ and then burned it;
content_old: 26 and brought forth the idolatrous pillars that were in the house of Baal､ and then burned it;

content: 27 and they brake down the pillars of Baal,—and brake down the house of Baal, and appointed it for a sewer-house—until this day.
content_old: 27 and they brake down the pillars of Baal,—and brake down the house of Baal, and appointed it for a sewer-house—until this day.

content: 28 Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.
content_old: 28 Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.

content: 29 Nevertheless as for the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit Jehu turned not away from following them,—the calves of gold, one being in Bethel､ and the other in Dan.
content_old: 29 Nevertheless as for the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit Jehu turned not away from following them,—the calves of gold, one being in Bethel､ and the other in Dan.

content: 30 And Yahweh said unto Jehu: Because thou hast done well､ by doing that which was right in mine eyes—according to all that was in my heart hast done to the house of Ahab sons of thine unto the fourth generation shall sit upon the throne of Israel.
content_old: 30 And Yahweh said unto Jehu: Because thou hast done well､ by doing that which was right in mine eyes—according to all that was in my heart hast done to the house of Ahab sons of thine unto the fourth generation shall sit upon the throne of Israel.

content: 31 But Jehu took not heed to walk in the law of Yahweh God of Israel､ with all his heart,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam, which he caused Israel to commit.
content_old: 31 But Jehu took not heed to walk in the law of Yahweh God of Israel､ with all his heart,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam, which he caused Israel to commit.

content: 32 In those days began Yahweh to make inroads in Israel,—and Hazael smote them in all the boundaries of Israel;
content_old: 32 In those days began Yahweh to make inroads in Israel,—and Hazael smote them in all the boundaries of Israel;

content: 33 from the Jordan､ towards sunrise all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites,—from Aroer､ which is by the torrent of Arnon, both Gilead and Bashan.
content_old: 33 from the Jordan､ towards sunrise all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites,—from Aroer､ which is by the torrent of Arnon, both Gilead and Bashan.

content: 34 Now the rest of the story of Jehu､ and all that he did､ and all his might are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 34 Now the rest of the story of Jehu､ and all that he did､ and all his might are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 35 And Jehu slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria,—and Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 35 And Jehu slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria,—and Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.

content: 1 Now when Athaliah､ mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead she arose and destroyed all the seed royal.
content_old: 1 Now when Athaliah､ mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead she arose and destroyed all the seed royal.

content: 2 But Jehosheba daughter of King Joram､ sister of Ahaziah､ took Joash son of Ahaziah､ and stole him from among the king’s sons that were being slain—him and his nurse into the bedchamber,—so she hid him from the face of Athaliah､ that he was not slain.
content_old: 2 But Jehosheba daughter of King Joram､ sister of Ahaziah､ took Joash son of Ahaziah､ and stole him from among the king’s sons that were being slain—him and his nurse into the bedchamber,—so she hid him from the face of Athaliah､ that he was not slain.

content: 3 And he was with her､ in the house of Yahweh, hiding himself､ six years,—while Athaliah was reigning over the land.
content_old: 3 And he was with her､ in the house of Yahweh, hiding himself､ six years,—while Athaliah was reigning over the land.

content: 4 But in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and took the captains over hundreds､ of the Carian body-guard､ and of the runners, and brought them unto him､ in the house of Yahweh,—and when he had solemnised a covenant with them､ and put them on oath､ in the house of Yahweh then shewed he them the king’s son;
content_old: 4 But in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and took the captains over hundreds､ of the Carian body-guard､ and of the runners, and brought them unto him､ in the house of Yahweh,—and when he had solemnised a covenant with them､ and put them on oath､ in the house of Yahweh then shewed he them the king’s son;

content: 5 and commanded them､ saying— This is the thing which ye must do,—A third part of you will be coming in on the sabbath, and keeping the watch of the house of the king;
content_old: 5 and commanded them､ saying— This is the thing which ye must do,—A third part of you will be coming in on the sabbath, and keeping the watch of the house of the king;

content: 6 and a third in the side-gate; and a third in the gate behind the runners,—so shall ye keep the watch of the house by turns.
content_old: 6 and a third in the side-gate; and a third in the gate behind the runners,—so shall ye keep the watch of the house by turns.

content: 7 And two parts of you are all that are going out on the sabbath,—so shall ye keep the watch of the house of Yahweh､ as touching the king.
content_old: 7 And two parts of you are all that are going out on the sabbath,—so shall ye keep the watch of the house of Yahweh､ as touching the king.

content: 8 Thus shall ye encompass the king round about､ every man with his weapons in his hand, and he that cometh within the ranks let him be slain,—so be ye with the king､ when he cometh out and when he goeth in.
content_old: 8 Thus shall ye encompass the king round about､ every man with his weapons in his hand, and he that cometh within the ranks let him be slain,—so be ye with the king､ when he cometh out and when he goeth in.

content: 9 And the captains of hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded, and they took every man his men who were coming in on the sabbath, with them who were going out on the sabbath,—and came unto Jehoiada the priest.
content_old: 9 And the captains of hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded, and they took every man his men who were coming in on the sabbath, with them who were going out on the sabbath,—and came unto Jehoiada the priest.

content: 10 And the priest gave unto the captains of hundreds the spears and the shields which belonged to King David,—which were in the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 10 And the priest gave unto the captains of hundreds the spears and the shields which belonged to King David,—which were in the house of Yahweh.

content: 11 And the runners stood､ every man with his weapons in his hand､ from the right corner of the house､ as far as the left corner of the house, by the altar and the house,—near the king､ round about.
content_old: 11 And the runners stood､ every man with his weapons in his hand､ from the right corner of the house､ as far as the left corner of the house, by the altar and the house,—near the king､ round about.

content: 12 Then brought he forth the king’s son､ and set upon him the crown､ and the testimony, and they made him king､ and anointed him,—and clapped their hands, and said— May the king live!
content_old: 12 Then brought he forth the king’s son､ and set upon him the crown､ and the testimony, and they made him king､ and anointed him,—and clapped their hands, and said— May the king live!

content: 13 And when Athaliah heard the noise of the runners､ the people then came she in unto the people､ in the house of Yahweh,
content_old: 13 And when Athaliah heard the noise of the runners､ the people then came she in unto the people､ in the house of Yahweh,

content: 14 and looked､ and lo! the king standing by the pillar､ as the custom was､ and the captains and the trumpeters､ by the king, and all the people of the land rejoicing, and blowing with trumpets,—so Athaliah rent her garments, and cried out— Conspiracy! conspiracy!
content_old: 14 and looked､ and lo! the king standing by the pillar､ as the custom was､ and the captains and the trumpeters､ by the king, and all the people of the land rejoicing, and blowing with trumpets,—so Athaliah rent her garments, and cried out— Conspiracy! conspiracy!

content: 15 And Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains of hundreds—officers of the force､ and said unto them— Take her forth into the inside of the ranks, and he that cometh in after her ye are to slay with the sword. For the priest said, Let her not be slain､ in the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 15 And Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains of hundreds—officers of the force､ and said unto them— Take her forth into the inside of the ranks, and he that cometh in after her ye are to slay with the sword. For the priest said, Let her not be slain､ in the house of Yahweh.

content: 16 So they made way for her, and she entered the road by which the horses approached the house of the king, and was slain there.
content_old: 16 So they made way for her, and she entered the road by which the horses approached the house of the king, and was slain there.

content: 17 And Jehoiada solemnised a covenant between Yahweh､ and the king､ and the people, that they should become a people unto Yahweh,—also between the king and the people.
content_old: 17 And Jehoiada solemnised a covenant between Yahweh､ and the king､ and the people, that they should become a people unto Yahweh,—also between the king and the people.

content: 18 And all the people of the land entered the house of Baal､ and brake it down､ his altars and his images brake they in pieces utterly, and Mattan the priest of Baal they slew before the altars,—and the priest appointed officers over the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 18 And all the people of the land entered the house of Baal､ and brake it down､ his altars and his images brake they in pieces utterly, and Mattan the priest of Baal they slew before the altars,—and the priest appointed officers over the house of Yahweh.

content: 19 And he took the captains of hundreds､ and the Carian bodyguard､ and the runners､ and all the people of the land､ and they brought down the king out of the house of Yahweh, and they came､ by way of the gate of the runners､ into the house of the king,—and he took his seat on the throne of the kings;
content_old: 19 And he took the captains of hundreds､ and the Carian bodyguard､ and the runners､ and all the people of the land､ and they brought down the king out of the house of Yahweh, and they came､ by way of the gate of the runners､ into the house of the king,—and he took his seat on the throne of the kings;

content: 20 and all the people of the land rejoiced､ and the city had rest,—when they had put Athaliah to death with the sword､ in the house of the king.
content_old: 20 and all the people of the land rejoiced､ and the city had rest,—when they had put Athaliah to death with the sword､ in the house of the king.

content: 1 In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign, and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
content_old: 1 In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign, and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.

content: 2 And Jehoash did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh all his days,—whereunto Jehoiada the priest instructed him:
content_old: 2 And Jehoash did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh all his days,—whereunto Jehoiada the priest instructed him:

content: 3 save only that the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.
content_old: 3 save only that the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.

content: 4 And Jehoash said unto the priests— All the silver of the hallowed things､ that is brought into the house of Yahweh—the silver of one who transgresseth, the silver of their persons by the estimate of each one,—all the silver which it cometh into any man’s heart to bring into the house of Yahweh
content_old: 4 And Jehoash said unto the priests— All the silver of the hallowed things､ that is brought into the house of Yahweh—the silver of one who transgresseth, the silver of their persons by the estimate of each one,—all the silver which it cometh into any man’s heart to bring into the house of Yahweh

content: 5 let the priests take to them､ every one from his acquaintance,—and let them repair the breaches of the house, wheresoever there may be found a breach.
content_old: 5 let the priests take to them､ every one from his acquaintance,—and let them repair the breaches of the house, wheresoever there may be found a breach.

content: 6 But it came to pass､ that in the twenty-third year of King Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.
content_old: 6 But it came to pass､ that in the twenty-third year of King Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.

content: 7 So King Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest and for the other priests, and said unto them— Why are ye not repairing the breaches of the house? Now therefore､ do not take silver from your acquaintances, for to repair the breaches of the house ought ye to have given it?
content_old: 7 So King Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest and for the other priests, and said unto them— Why are ye not repairing the breaches of the house? Now therefore､ do not take silver from your acquaintances, for to repair the breaches of the house ought ye to have given it?

content: 8 The priests therefore consented､ not to take silver from the people, and not to repair the breaches of the house.
content_old: 8 The priests therefore consented､ not to take silver from the people, and not to repair the breaches of the house.

content: 9 Then took Jehoiada a certain chest, and bored a hole in the door thereof,—and set it beside the alta､ on the right as one entereth into the house of Yahweh, and the priests that kept the entrance-hall､ used to put therein—all the silver that was brought into the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 9 Then took Jehoiada a certain chest, and bored a hole in the door thereof,—and set it beside the alta､ on the right as one entereth into the house of Yahweh, and the priests that kept the entrance-hall､ used to put therein—all the silver that was brought into the house of Yahweh.

content: 10 And it came to pass when they saw that there was much silver in the chest that the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and brought together and counted the silver that was found in the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 10 And it came to pass when they saw that there was much silver in the chest that the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and brought together and counted the silver that was found in the house of Yahweh;

content: 11 then used they to give the silver that had been weighed out, into the hands of the doers of the work, who had oversight of the house of Yahweh,—and they brought it forth､ to the carpenters､ and to the builders, who were working upon the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 11 then used they to give the silver that had been weighed out, into the hands of the doers of the work, who had oversight of the house of Yahweh,—and they brought it forth､ to the carpenters､ and to the builders, who were working upon the house of Yahweh;

content: 12 and to the masons､ and to the hewers of stone, and to buy timber､ and hewn stone, for repairing the breaches of the house of Yahweh,—and to every one that went out upon the house､ to repair it.
content_old: 12 and to the masons､ and to the hewers of stone, and to buy timber､ and hewn stone, for repairing the breaches of the house of Yahweh,—and to every one that went out upon the house､ to repair it.

content: 13 Howbeit there were not made for the house of Yahweh､ bowls of silver､ snuffers､ dashing basins､ trumpets, any vessel of gold､ or any vessel of silver,—out of the silver that was brought into the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 13 Howbeit there were not made for the house of Yahweh､ bowls of silver､ snuffers､ dashing basins､ trumpets, any vessel of gold､ or any vessel of silver,—out of the silver that was brought into the house of Yahweh;

content: 14 for to the doers of the work used they to give it; and so they repaired､ therewith､ the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 14 for to the doers of the work used they to give it; and so they repaired､ therewith､ the house of Yahweh.

content: 15 And they used not to reckon with the men into whose hands they gave the silver, to give it to the doers of the work,—because with faithfulness were they dealing.
content_old: 15 And they used not to reckon with the men into whose hands they gave the silver, to give it to the doers of the work,—because with faithfulness were they dealing.

content: 16 Silver for guilt-offerings and silver for sin-offerings was not brought into the house of Yahweh,—to the priests they belonged.
content_old: 16 Silver for guilt-offerings and silver for sin-offerings was not brought into the house of Yahweh,—to the priests they belonged.

content: 17 Then came up Hazael､ king of Syria, and fought against Gath､ and captured it,—so Hazael set his face to go up against Jerusalem.
content_old: 17 Then came up Hazael､ king of Syria, and fought against Gath､ and captured it,—so Hazael set his face to go up against Jerusalem.

content: 18 Therefore did Jehoash､ king of Judah､ take all the hallowed things which Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah､ his fathers､ kings of Judah､ had hallowed､ and his own hallowed things, and all the gold that was found in the treasuries of the house of Yahweh and the house of the king,—and sent to Hazael king of Syria, so he went up from against Jerusalem.
content_old: 18 Therefore did Jehoash､ king of Judah､ take all the hallowed things which Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah､ his fathers､ kings of Judah､ had hallowed､ and his own hallowed things, and all the gold that was found in the treasuries of the house of Yahweh and the house of the king,—and sent to Hazael king of Syria, so he went up from against Jerusalem.

content: 19 Now the rest of the story of Joash､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 19 Now the rest of the story of Joash､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 20 And his servants arose and made a conspiracy､ and smote Joash, in the house of Millo which goeth down to Silla.
content_old: 20 And his servants arose and made a conspiracy､ and smote Joash, in the house of Millo which goeth down to Silla.

content: 1 In the twenty-third year of Joash son of Ahaziah king of Judah began Jehoahaz､ son of Jehu､ to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, and he reigned seventeen years.
content_old: 1 In the twenty-third year of Joash son of Ahaziah king of Judah began Jehoahaz､ son of Jehu､ to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, and he reigned seventeen years.

content: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—and went after the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat which he caused Israel to commit､ he departed not therefrom.
content_old: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—and went after the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat which he caused Israel to commit､ he departed not therefrom.

content: 3 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh against Israel,—and he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria､ and into the hand of Ben-hadad son of Hazael､ continually.
content_old: 3 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh against Israel,—and he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria､ and into the hand of Ben-hadad son of Hazael､ continually.

content: 4 And Jehoahaz appeased the face of Yahweh,—and Yahweh hearkened unto him, because he had seen the oppression of Israel, for that the king of Syria oppressed them.
content_old: 4 And Jehoahaz appeased the face of Yahweh,—and Yahweh hearkened unto him, because he had seen the oppression of Israel, for that the king of Syria oppressed them.

content: 5 So Yahweh gave unto Israel a saviour, and they went forth from under the hand of Syria,—and the sons of Israel dwelt in their own homes､ as aforetime.
content_old: 5 So Yahweh gave unto Israel a saviour, and they went forth from under the hand of Syria,—and the sons of Israel dwelt in their own homes､ as aforetime.

content: 6 Howbeit they departed not from the sins of the house of Jeroboam which he caused Israel to commit､ therein they walked,—moreover also the Sacred Stem still stood in Samaria.
content_old: 6 Howbeit they departed not from the sins of the house of Jeroboam which he caused Israel to commit､ therein they walked,—moreover also the Sacred Stem still stood in Samaria.

content: 7 For he had not left remaining unto Jehoahaz a people､ save only fifty horsemen､ and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen,—for the king of Syria had destroyed them, and had made them like dust in threshing.
content_old: 7 For he had not left remaining unto Jehoahaz a people､ save only fifty horsemen､ and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen,—for the king of Syria had destroyed them, and had made them like dust in threshing.

content: 8 Now the rest of the story of Jehoahaz､ and all that he did､ and his might are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 8 Now the rest of the story of Jehoahaz､ and all that he did､ and his might are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 9 So then Jehoahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria,—and Joash his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 9 So then Jehoahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria,—and Joash his son reigned in his stead.

content: 10 In the thirty-seventh year of Jonah king of Judah began Jehoash son of Jehoahaz to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, and he reigned sixteen years.
content_old: 10 In the thirty-seventh year of Jonah king of Judah began Jehoash son of Jehoahaz to reign over Israel､ in Samaria, and he reigned sixteen years.

content: 11 And he did that which was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from all the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit､ therein he walked.
content_old: 11 And he did that which was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from all the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit､ therein he walked.

content: 12 Now the rest of the story of Joash､ and all that he did, and his might, wherewith he fought against Amaziah king of Judah are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 12 Now the rest of the story of Joash､ and all that he did, and his might, wherewith he fought against Amaziah king of Judah are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 13 So then Joash slept with his fathers､ and Jeroboam took his seat on his throne,—and Joash was buried in Samaria, with the kings of Israel.
content_old: 13 So then Joash slept with his fathers､ and Jeroboam took his seat on his throne,—and Joash was buried in Samaria, with the kings of Israel.

content: 14 Now Elisha had fallen sick of his sickness whereof he was about to die,—so then Joash king of Israel came down unto him､ and wept upon his face､ and said, My father! my father! The chariots of Israel and the horsemen thereof!
content_old: 14 Now Elisha had fallen sick of his sickness whereof he was about to die,—so then Joash king of Israel came down unto him､ and wept upon his face､ and said, My father! my father! The chariots of Israel and the horsemen thereof!

content: 15 And Elisha said unto him, Take bow and arrows. So he took unto him bow and arrows.
content_old: 15 And Elisha said unto him, Take bow and arrows. So he took unto him bow and arrows.

content: 16 Then said he unto the king of Israel, Let thy hand rest upon the bow. So he let his hand rest thereon. Then Elisha put his own hands upon the hands of the king;
content_old: 16 Then said he unto the king of Israel, Let thy hand rest upon the bow. So he let his hand rest thereon. Then Elisha put his own hands upon the hands of the king;

content: 17 and said— Open the lattice eastward. And he opened it. Then said Elisha—Shoot! And he shot. Then he said,— The arrow of victory by Yahweh､ Yea the arrow of victory over Syria, Therefore shalt thou smite Syria in Aphek､ till it be consumed.
content_old: 17 and said— Open the lattice eastward. And he opened it. Then said Elisha—Shoot! And he shot. Then he said,— The arrow of victory by Yahweh､ Yea the arrow of victory over Syria, Therefore shalt thou smite Syria in Aphek､ till it be consumed.

content: 18 And he said— Take the arrows. So he took them. Then said he unto the king of Israel— Smite unto the ground. So he smote three times､ and then stayed.
content_old: 18 And he said— Take the arrows. So he took them. Then said he unto the king of Israel— Smite unto the ground. So he smote three times､ and then stayed.

content: 19 Then was the man of God wroth against him､ and said— Thou shouldest have smitten five or six times, then hadst thou smitten Syria､ until it had been consumed; But now three times shalt thou smite Syria.
content_old: 19 Then was the man of God wroth against him､ and said— Thou shouldest have smitten five or six times, then hadst thou smitten Syria､ until it had been consumed; But now three times shalt thou smite Syria.

content: 20 And Elisha died､ and they buried him,—now troops of Moabitesll used to enter the land､ at the coming in of the year;
content_old: 20 And Elisha died､ and they buried him,—now troops of Moabitesll used to enter the land､ at the coming in of the year;

content: 21 and it came to pass as they were burying a man that､ lo! they saw a troop, so they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha,—and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha he came to life again､ and rose up on his feet.
content_old: 21 and it came to pass as they were burying a man that､ lo! they saw a troop, so they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha,—and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha he came to life again､ and rose up on his feet.

content: 22 And Hazael king of Syria had oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
content_old: 22 And Hazael king of Syria had oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.

content: 23 Then was Yahweh gracious unto them､ and had compassion upon them､ and turned unto them, for the sake of his covenant with Abraham､ Isaac､ and Jacob,—and was not willing to destroy them, nor to cast them off from his presence as yet.
content_old: 23 Then was Yahweh gracious unto them､ and had compassion upon them､ and turned unto them, for the sake of his covenant with Abraham､ Isaac､ and Jacob,—and was not willing to destroy them, nor to cast them off from his presence as yet.

content: 24 So then Hazael king of Syria died; and Ben-hadad his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 24 So then Hazael king of Syria died; and Ben-hadad his son reigned in his stead.

content: 1 In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel began Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah to reign.
content_old: 1 In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel began Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah to reign.

content: 2 Twenty-five years old was he when he began to reign, and twenty-nine years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 Twenty-five years old was he when he began to reign, and twenty-nine years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.

content: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, only not like David his father: according to all that Joash his father did so he did;
content_old: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, only not like David his father: according to all that Joash his father did so he did;

content: 4 only the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.
content_old: 4 only the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.

content: 5 And it came to pass that as soon as the kingdom was confirmed in his hand he smote his servants who smote the king his father;
content_old: 5 And it came to pass that as soon as the kingdom was confirmed in his hand he smote his servants who smote the king his father;

content: 6 but the sons of them that smote him slew he not,—as it is written in the book of the law of Moses､ which Yahweh commanded､saying— Fathers shall not be put to death for sons､ Nor shall sons be put to death for fathers, But every man for his own sin shall be put to death.
content_old: 6 but the sons of them that smote him slew he not,—as it is written in the book of the law of Moses､ which Yahweh commanded､saying— Fathers shall not be put to death for sons､ Nor shall sons be put to death for fathers, But every man for his own sin shall be put to death.

content: 7 He smote Edom､ in the valley of salt､ ten thousand, and seized Sela､ in the war,—and called the name thereof Joktheel, as it is until this day.
content_old: 7 He smote Edom､ in the valley of salt､ ten thousand, and seized Sela､ in the war,—and called the name thereof Joktheel, as it is until this day.

content: 8 Then sent Amaziah messengers unto Jehoash son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu､ king of Israel､ saying,— Come now､ let us look one another in the face.
content_old: 8 Then sent Amaziah messengers unto Jehoash son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu､ king of Israel､ saying,— Come now､ let us look one another in the face.

content: 9 And Jehoash king of Israel sent unto Amaziah king of Judah､ saying, A thistle that was in Lebanon sent unto a cedar that was in Lebanon､ saying— Give thy daughter to my son to wife,—and there passed by a beast of the field that was in Lebanon, and trampled down the thistle:
content_old: 9 And Jehoash king of Israel sent unto Amaziah king of Judah､ saying, A thistle that was in Lebanon sent unto a cedar that was in Lebanon､ saying— Give thy daughter to my son to wife,—and there passed by a beast of the field that was in Lebanon, and trampled down the thistle:

content: 10 Thou hast smitten Edom, and thy heart would lift thee up,— Glory､ and stay at home! Wherefore､ then､ shouldest thou contend with misfortune, and fall, thou､ and Judah with thee?
content_old: 10 Thou hast smitten Edom, and thy heart would lift thee up,— Glory､ and stay at home! Wherefore､ then､ shouldest thou contend with misfortune, and fall, thou､ and Judah with thee?

content: 11 But Amaziah hearkened not. So then Jehoash king of Israel came up, and they looked one another in the face, he and Amaziah king of Judah,—in Beth-shemesh､ which belongeth unto Judah.
content_old: 11 But Amaziah hearkened not. So then Jehoash king of Israel came up, and they looked one another in the face, he and Amaziah king of Judah,—in Beth-shemesh､ which belongeth unto Judah.

content: 12 Then was Judah defeated before Israel,—and they fled､ every man to his own home;
content_old: 12 Then was Judah defeated before Israel,—and they fled､ every man to his own home;

content: 13 and upon Amaziah､ king of Judah､ son of Jehoash son of Ahaziah did Jehoash king of Israel seize in Beth-shemesh,—and entered Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem､ at the gate of Ephraim､ as far as the corner gate, four hundred cubits;
content_old: 13 and upon Amaziah､ king of Judah､ son of Jehoash son of Ahaziah did Jehoash king of Israel seize in Beth-shemesh,—and entered Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem､ at the gate of Ephraim､ as far as the corner gate, four hundred cubits;

content: 14 and took all the gold and the silver and all the vessels that were found in the house of Yahweh､ and in the treasuries of the house of the king, and hostages,—and returned to Samaria.
content_old: 14 and took all the gold and the silver and all the vessels that were found in the house of Yahweh､ and in the treasuries of the house of the king, and hostages,—and returned to Samaria.

content: 15 Now the rest of the story of Jehoash､ what he did､ and his might､ and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 15 Now the rest of the story of Jehoash､ what he did､ and his might､ and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 16 And Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria, with the kings of Israel,—and Jeroboam his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 16 And Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria, with the kings of Israel,—and Jeroboam his son reigned in his stead.

content: 17 And Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
content_old: 17 And Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.

content: 18 Now the rest of the story of Amaziah is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 18 Now the rest of the story of Amaziah is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 19 And when they made against him a conspiracy in Jerusalem he fled to Lachish,—but they sent after him to Lachish, and slew him there.
content_old: 19 And when they made against him a conspiracy in Jerusalem he fled to Lachish,—but they sent after him to Lachish, and slew him there.

content: 20 And they bare him on horses,—and he was buried in Jerusalem､ with his fathers､ in the city of David.
content_old: 20 And they bare him on horses,—and he was buried in Jerusalem､ with his fathers､ in the city of David.

content: 21 And all the people of Judah took Azariah, he being sixteen years old,—and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.
content_old: 21 And all the people of Judah took Azariah, he being sixteen years old,—and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.

content: 22 He built Elath, and restored it to Judah,—after the king slept with his fathers.
content_old: 22 He built Elath, and restored it to Judah,—after the king slept with his fathers.

content: 23 In the fifteenth year of Amaziah､ son of Joash､ king of Judah began Jeroboam､ son of Joash､ king of Israel､ to reign in Samaria, and he reigned forty-one years.
content_old: 23 In the fifteenth year of Amaziah､ son of Joash､ king of Judah began Jeroboam､ son of Joash､ king of Israel､ to reign in Samaria, and he reigned forty-one years.

content: 24 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from any of the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.
content_old: 24 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from any of the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.

content: 25 He restored the boundary of Israel, from the entering in of Hamath､ unto the sea of the waste plain,—according to the word of Yahweh､ God of Israel, which he spake by the hand of his servant Jonah､ son of Amittai､ the prophet, who was of Gath-hepher.
content_old: 25 He restored the boundary of Israel, from the entering in of Hamath､ unto the sea of the waste plain,—according to the word of Yahweh､ God of Israel, which he spake by the hand of his servant Jonah､ son of Amittai､ the prophet, who was of Gath-hepher.

content: 26 For Yahweh saw the humiliation of Israel､ that it was bitter indeed,—and that there was no one shut up､ nor any one left at large, no one indeed to help Israel.
content_old: 26 For Yahweh saw the humiliation of Israel､ that it was bitter indeed,—and that there was no one shut up､ nor any one left at large, no one indeed to help Israel.

content: 27 Neither had Yahweh spoken､ to wipe out the name of Israel from under the heavens,—so he saved them, by the hand of Jeroboam son of Joash.
content_old: 27 Neither had Yahweh spoken､ to wipe out the name of Israel from under the heavens,—so he saved them, by the hand of Jeroboam son of Joash.

content: 28 Now the rest of the story of Jeroboam､ and all that he did､ and his might when he warred, and how he restored Damascus and Hamath to Judah in Israel are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 28 Now the rest of the story of Jeroboam､ and all that he did､ and his might when he warred, and how he restored Damascus and Hamath to Judah in Israel are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 1 In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.
content_old: 1 In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.

content: 2 Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign, and fifty-two years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Jecholiah､ of Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign, and fifty-two years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Jecholiah､ of Jerusalem.

content: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Amaziah his father had done.
content_old: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Amaziah his father had done.

content: 4 Only the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.
content_old: 4 Only the high places took they not away,—still were the people sacrificing and burning incense in the high places.

content: 5 And Yahweh smote the king､ so that he became a leper､ until the day of his death, and dwelt in a lazar-house,—and Jotham､ son of the king was over the house, judging the people of the land.
content_old: 5 And Yahweh smote the king､ so that he became a leper､ until the day of his death, and dwelt in a lazar-house,—and Jotham､ son of the king was over the house, judging the people of the land.

content: 6 Now the rest of the story of Azariah､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 6 Now the rest of the story of Azariah､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 7 And Azariah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers､ in the city of David,—and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 7 And Azariah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers､ in the city of David,—and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.

content: 8 In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah began Zechariah son of Jeroboam to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned six months.
content_old: 8 In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah began Zechariah son of Jeroboam to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned six months.

content: 9 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh, as did his fathers,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.
content_old: 9 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh, as did his fathers,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.

content: 10 Then conspired against him､ Shallum son of Jabesh, and smote him before the people､ and slew him,—and reigned in his stead.
content_old: 10 Then conspired against him､ Shallum son of Jabesh, and smote him before the people､ and slew him,—and reigned in his stead.

content: 11 Now the rest of the story of Zechariah behold it! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
content_old: 11 Now the rest of the story of Zechariah behold it! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.

content: 12 That was the word of Yahweh､ which he spake unto Jehu､ saying, Thy sons､ to four generations shall sit on the throne of Israel. And it was so!
content_old: 12 That was the word of Yahweh､ which he spake unto Jehu､ saying, Thy sons､ to four generations shall sit on the throne of Israel. And it was so!

content: 13 Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign, in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah､ king of Judah,—for the space of a month in Samaria.
content_old: 13 Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign, in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah､ king of Judah,—for the space of a month in Samaria.

content: 14 Then came up Menahem son of Gadi､ from Tirzah､ and entered Samaria, and smote Shallum son of Jabesh in Samaria,—and slew him､ and reigned in his stead.
content_old: 14 Then came up Menahem son of Gadi､ from Tirzah､ and entered Samaria, and smote Shallum son of Jabesh in Samaria,—and slew him､ and reigned in his stead.

content: 15 Now the rest of the story of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!
content_old: 15 Now the rest of the story of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!

content: 16 Then Menahem smote Tiphsah､ and all that were therein､ and the boundaries thereof､ from Tirzah, because they opened not therefore he smote them,—all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.
content_old: 16 Then Menahem smote Tiphsah､ and all that were therein､ and the boundaries thereof､ from Tirzah, because they opened not therefore he smote them,—all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.

content: 17 In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem son of Gadi to reign over Israel､ ten years reigned he ､ in Samaria.
content_old: 17 In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem son of Gadi to reign over Israel､ ten years reigned he ､ in Samaria.

content: 18 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit, all his days.
content_old: 18 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat､ which he caused Israel to commit, all his days.

content: 19 Pul the king of Assyria came against the land, so Menahem gave unto Pul, a thousand talents of silver,—that his hands might be with him, to confirm the kingdom､ in his hand.
content_old: 19 Pul the king of Assyria came against the land, so Menahem gave unto Pul, a thousand talents of silver,—that his hands might be with him, to confirm the kingdom､ in his hand.

content: 20 And Menahem exacted the silver of Israel､ of all the mighty men of wealth, to give to the king of Assyria, fifty shekels of silver､ of each man,—so the king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there､ in the land.
content_old: 20 And Menahem exacted the silver of Israel､ of all the mighty men of wealth, to give to the king of Assyria, fifty shekels of silver､ of each man,—so the king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there､ in the land.

content: 21 Now the rest of the story of Menahem､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
content_old: 21 Now the rest of the story of Menahem､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

content: 22 And Menahem slept with his fathers,—and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 22 And Menahem slept with his fathers,—and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.

content: 23 In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Pekahiah son of Menahem to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned two years.
content_old: 23 In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Pekahiah son of Menahem to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned two years.

content: 24 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.
content_old: 24 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.

content: 25 And there conspired against him—Pekah son of Remaliah､ a hero of his､ and smote him in Samaria､ in the citadel of the house of a king､ with Argob and with Ariel, and with him fifty men of the sons of the Gileadites,—and he slew him､ and reigned in his stead.
content_old: 25 And there conspired against him—Pekah son of Remaliah､ a hero of his､ and smote him in Samaria､ in the citadel of the house of a king､ with Argob and with Ariel, and with him fifty men of the sons of the Gileadites,—and he slew him､ and reigned in his stead.

content: 26 Now the rest of the story of Pekahiah､ and all that he did behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!
content_old: 26 Now the rest of the story of Pekahiah､ and all that he did behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!

content: 27 In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah began Pekah son of Remaliah to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned twenty years.
content_old: 27 In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah began Pekah son of Remaliah to reign over Israel､ in Samaria､ and he reigned twenty years.

content: 28 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.
content_old: 28 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—he turned not away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he caused Israel to commit.

content: 29 In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglath-pileser､ king of Assyria, and took Ijon､ and Abel-beth-maachah､ and Janoah､ and Kedesh､ and Hazor､ and Gilead､ and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali,—and carried them away captive to Assyria.
content_old: 29 In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglath-pileser､ king of Assyria, and took Ijon､ and Abel-beth-maachah､ and Janoah､ and Kedesh､ and Hazor､ and Gilead､ and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali,—and carried them away captive to Assyria.

content: 30 And Hoshea son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah､ son of Remaliah, and smote him､ and slew him, and reigned in his stead,—in the twentieth year of Jotham､ son of Uzziah.
content_old: 30 And Hoshea son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah､ son of Remaliah, and smote him､ and slew him, and reigned in his stead,—in the twentieth year of Jotham､ son of Uzziah.

content: 31 Now the rest of the story of Pekah､ and all that he did behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!
content_old: 31 Now the rest of the story of Pekah､ and all that he did behold them! written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel!

content: 32 In the second year of Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.
content_old: 32 In the second year of Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.

content: 33 Twenty-five years old was he､ when he began to reign, and sixteen years reigned he､ in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Jerusha､ daughter of Zadok.
content_old: 33 Twenty-five years old was he､ when he began to reign, and sixteen years reigned he､ in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Jerusha､ daughter of Zadok.

content: 34 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Uzziah his father had done.
content_old: 34 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Uzziah his father had done.

content: 35 Only the high places took they not away, still were the people offering sacrifice and burning incense in the high places,—he built the upper gate of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 35 Only the high places took they not away, still were the people offering sacrifice and burning incense in the high places,—he built the upper gate of the house of Yahweh.

content: 36 Now the rest of the story of Jotham､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 36 Now the rest of the story of Jotham､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 37 In those days began Yahweh to send against Judah, Rezin､ king of Syria,—and Pekah son of Remaliah.
content_old: 37 In those days began Yahweh to send against Judah, Rezin､ king of Syria,—and Pekah son of Remaliah.

content: 1 In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah began Ahaz son of Jotham king of Judah to reign.
content_old: 1 In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah began Ahaz son of Jotham king of Judah to reign.

content: 2 Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign, and sixteen years reigned he in Jerusalem. And he did not that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh his God､ like David his father;
content_old: 2 Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign, and sixteen years reigned he in Jerusalem. And he did not that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh his God､ like David his father;

content: 3 but walked in the way of the kings of Israel,—moreover also he made his son pass through the fire, according to the abominable practices of the nations, whom Yahweh dispossessed from before the sons of Israel;
content_old: 3 but walked in the way of the kings of Israel,—moreover also he made his son pass through the fire, according to the abominable practices of the nations, whom Yahweh dispossessed from before the sons of Israel;

content: 4 and he offered sacrifice and burned incense in the high places､ and on the hills,—and under every green tree.
content_old: 4 and he offered sacrifice and burned incense in the high places､ and on the hills,—and under every green tree.

content: 5 Then came up Rezin king of Syria､ and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel､ unto Jerusalem､ to make war,—and they laid siege against Ahaz, but could not overcome him.
content_old: 5 Then came up Rezin king of Syria､ and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel､ unto Jerusalem､ to make war,—and they laid siege against Ahaz, but could not overcome him.

content: 6 At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath､ to Syria, and wholly cleared out the Jews from Eloth,—and the Syrians entered Elath, and have dwelt there､ unto this day.
content_old: 6 At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath､ to Syria, and wholly cleared out the Jews from Eloth,—and the Syrians entered Elath, and have dwelt there､ unto this day.

content: 7 So Ahaz sent messengers unto Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria､ saying, Thy servant and thy son I am,— Come up and save me､ out of the hand of the king of Syria､ and out of the hand of the king of Israel, who are rising up against me.
content_old: 7 So Ahaz sent messengers unto Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria､ saying, Thy servant and thy son I am,— Come up and save me､ out of the hand of the king of Syria､ and out of the hand of the king of Israel, who are rising up against me.

content: 8 And Ahaz took the silver and the gold that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasuries of the house of the king,—and sent them to the king of Assyria､ as a bribe.
content_old: 8 And Ahaz took the silver and the gold that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasuries of the house of the king,—and sent them to the king of Assyria､ as a bribe.

content: 9 So the king of Assyria hearkened unto him, and the king of Assyria came up unto Damascus､ and seized it, and carried away the people thereof captive to Kir,—and put Rezin to death.
content_old: 9 So the king of Assyria hearkened unto him, and the king of Assyria came up unto Damascus､ and seized it, and carried away the people thereof captive to Kir,—and put Rezin to death.

content: 10 So then King Ahaz went to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria､ in Damascus, and saw the altar which was in Damascus,—and King Ahaz sent､ unto Urijah the priest､ a likeness of the altar､ and a model thereof､ according to all the workmanship thereof;
content_old: 10 So then King Ahaz went to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria､ in Damascus, and saw the altar which was in Damascus,—and King Ahaz sent､ unto Urijah the priest､ a likeness of the altar､ and a model thereof､ according to all the workmanship thereof;

content: 11 and Urijah the priest built an altar,—according to all that King Ahaz sent from Damascus so did Urijah the priest make it､ by the time King Ahaz came from Damascus.
content_old: 11 and Urijah the priest built an altar,—according to all that King Ahaz sent from Damascus so did Urijah the priest make it､ by the time King Ahaz came from Damascus.

content: 12 And when the king came from Damascus then the king saw the altar,—so the king drew near unto the altar､ and caused offerings to ascend thereupon.
content_old: 12 And when the king came from Damascus then the king saw the altar,—so the king drew near unto the altar､ and caused offerings to ascend thereupon.

content: 13 And he made perfume with his ascending-sacrifice､ and with his meal-offering, and poured out his drink-offering,—and dashed the blood of the peace-offerings which he had､ upon the altar.
content_old: 13 And he made perfume with his ascending-sacrifice､ and with his meal-offering, and poured out his drink-offering,—and dashed the blood of the peace-offerings which he had､ upon the altar.

content: 14 And the altar of bronze which was before Yahweh he brought away from the forefront of the house, from between the altar､ and the house of Yahweh,—and put it at the side of the altar northward.
content_old: 14 And the altar of bronze which was before Yahweh he brought away from the forefront of the house, from between the altar､ and the house of Yahweh,—and put it at the side of the altar northward.

content: 15 And King Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest､ saying— Upon the great altar make thou perfume with the ascending-sacrifice of the morning､ and with the meal-offering of the evening､ and with the ascending-sacrifice of the king and with his meal-offering､ and with the ascending-sacrifice of all the people of the land､ and their meal-offering and their drink-offering, and all the blood of the ascending-offering､ and all the blood of the peace offering thereupon shalt thou dash,—but the altar of bronze shall be for me to inquire into.
