content_old: 15 And King Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest､ saying— Upon the great altar make thou perfume with the ascending-sacrifice of the morning､ and with the meal-offering of the evening､ and with the ascending-sacrifice of the king and with his meal-offering､ and with the ascending-sacrifice of all the people of the land､ and their meal-offering and their drink-offering, and all the blood of the ascending-offering､ and all the blood of the peace offering thereupon shalt thou dash,—but the altar of bronze shall be for me to inquire into.

content: 16 So Urijah the priest did according to all that King Ahaz commanded.
content_old: 16 So Urijah the priest did according to all that King Ahaz commanded.

content: 17 And King Ahaz cut off the side walls of the stands､ and took away from off them the laver, and the sea took he down from off the oxen of bronze､ which were under it,—and set it on a pavement of stones.
content_old: 17 And King Ahaz cut off the side walls of the stands､ and took away from off them the laver, and the sea took he down from off the oxen of bronze､ which were under it,—and set it on a pavement of stones.

content: 18 Also the covered walk for the Sabbath､ which they had built in the house､ and the outer entrance for the king he changed in the house of Yahweh,—because of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 18 Also the covered walk for the Sabbath､ which they had built in the house､ and the outer entrance for the king he changed in the house of Yahweh,—because of the king of Assyria.

content: 19 Now the rest of the story of Ahaz､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 19 Now the rest of the story of Ahaz､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 1 In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah began Hoshea son of Elah to reign in Samaria､ over Israel､ and he reigned nine years.
content_old: 1 In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah began Hoshea son of Elah to reign in Samaria､ over Israel､ and he reigned nine years.

content: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—only not like the kings of Israel who were before him.
content_old: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—only not like the kings of Israel who were before him.

content: 3 Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria,—and Hoshea became his servant, and rendered him a present.
content_old: 3 Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria,—and Hoshea became his servant, and rendered him a present.

content: 4 Then found the king of Assyria､ in Hoshea､ a conspiracy､ in that he had sent messengers unto So king of Egypt, and had not brought up a present to the king of Assyria､ as he had done year by year,—therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.
content_old: 4 Then found the king of Assyria､ in Hoshea､ a conspiracy､ in that he had sent messengers unto So king of Egypt, and had not brought up a present to the king of Assyria､ as he had done year by year,—therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.

content: 5 And the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land,—yea he came up to Samaria and besieged it three years.
content_old: 5 And the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land,—yea he came up to Samaria and besieged it three years.

content: 6 In the ninth year of Hoshea did the king of Assyria capture Samaria, and carried Israel away captive to Assyria,—and settled them in Halah､ and in Habor by the river of Gozan､ and the mountains of Media.
content_old: 6 In the ninth year of Hoshea did the king of Assyria capture Samaria, and carried Israel away captive to Assyria,—and settled them in Halah､ and in Habor by the river of Gozan､ and the mountains of Media.

content: 7 And thus it came to pass that Israel sinned against Yahweh their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt,—yea they did reverence to other gods;
content_old: 7 And thus it came to pass that Israel sinned against Yahweh their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt,—yea they did reverence to other gods;

content: 8 and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Yahweh had dispossessed from before the sons of Israel,—and in the statutes of the kings of Israel､ which they had made.
content_old: 8 and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Yahweh had dispossessed from before the sons of Israel,—and in the statutes of the kings of Israel､ which they had made.

content: 9 And the sons of Israel did secretly things which were not right, against Yahweh their God,—and built for themselves high places in all their cities, from the watchmen’s tower､ to the fortified city.
content_old: 9 And the sons of Israel did secretly things which were not right, against Yahweh their God,—and built for themselves high places in all their cities, from the watchmen’s tower､ to the fortified city.

content: 10 And they set up for themselves pillars and Sacred Stems, upon every high hill, and under every green tree;
content_old: 10 And they set up for themselves pillars and Sacred Stems, upon every high hill, and under every green tree;

content: 11 and burned incense there､ in all the high places, like the nations whom Yahweh drave out from before them,—and did things that were wicked, so as to provoke Yahweh to anger;
content_old: 11 and burned incense there､ in all the high places, like the nations whom Yahweh drave out from before them,—and did things that were wicked, so as to provoke Yahweh to anger;

content: 12 and they served the manufactured gods､ as to which Yahweh had said to them, Ye shall not do this thing.
content_old: 12 and they served the manufactured gods､ as to which Yahweh had said to them, Ye shall not do this thing.

content: 13 And Yahweh testified against Israel and against Judah､ through all his prophets—every one who had a vision､ saying— Turn ye from your wicked ways, And keep my commandments､ my statutes, According to all the law which I commanded your fathers; And which I sent unto you through my servants the prophets.
content_old: 13 And Yahweh testified against Israel and against Judah､ through all his prophets—every one who had a vision､ saying— Turn ye from your wicked ways, And keep my commandments､ my statutes, According to all the law which I commanded your fathers; And which I sent unto you through my servants the prophets.

content: 14 Howbeit they hearkened not,—but stiffened their neck､ like the neck of their fathers, who trusted not in Yahweh their God;
content_old: 14 Howbeit they hearkened not,—but stiffened their neck､ like the neck of their fathers, who trusted not in Yahweh their God;

content: 15 but rejected his statutes､ and his covenant､ which he solemnised with their fathers, and his testimonies wherewith he testified against them,—and followed vanity､ and became vain, and followed the nations that were round about them, as to whom Yahweh charged them, so that they should not do like them.
content_old: 15 but rejected his statutes､ and his covenant､ which he solemnised with their fathers, and his testimonies wherewith he testified against them,—and followed vanity､ and became vain, and followed the nations that were round about them, as to whom Yahweh charged them, so that they should not do like them.

content: 16 But they forsook all the commandments of Yahweh their God, and made for themselves something molten—two calves, and made a Sacred Stem､ and bowed themselves down to all the army of the heavens, and served Baal;
content_old: 16 But they forsook all the commandments of Yahweh their God, and made for themselves something molten—two calves, and made a Sacred Stem､ and bowed themselves down to all the army of the heavens, and served Baal;

content: 17 and made their sons and their daughters pass through the fire, and used divinations and enchantments, and sold the mselves to do the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ provoking him to wrath.
content_old: 17 and made their sons and their daughters pass through the fire, and used divinations and enchantments, and sold the mselves to do the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ provoking him to wrath.

content: 18 So Yahweh shewed himself exceeding angry with Israel, and removed them from his presence,—there was none left, save the tribe of Judah alone.
content_old: 18 So Yahweh shewed himself exceeding angry with Israel, and removed them from his presence,—there was none left, save the tribe of Judah alone.

content: 19 Even JudahII kept not the commandments of Yahweh their God,—but walked in the statutes of Israel､ which they had made.
content_old: 19 Even JudahII kept not the commandments of Yahweh their God,—but walked in the statutes of Israel､ which they had made.

content: 20 So Yahweh rejected all the seed of Israel､ and humiliated them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers,—until he had cast them out from his presence;
content_old: 20 So Yahweh rejected all the seed of Israel､ and humiliated them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers,—until he had cast them out from his presence;

content: 21 for he rent Israel away from the house of David, and they made Jeroboam son of Nebat､ king,—and Jeroboam thrust away Israel from following Yahweh, and caused them to commit a great sin.
content_old: 21 for he rent Israel away from the house of David, and they made Jeroboam son of Nebat､ king,—and Jeroboam thrust away Israel from following Yahweh, and caused them to commit a great sin.

content: 22 And the sons of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he had committed,—they turned not away therefrom;
content_old: 22 And the sons of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he had committed,—they turned not away therefrom;

content: 23 until that Yahweh removed Israel from his presence, according as he spake through all his servants the prophets,—and so Israel was driven away from off their own soil､ to Assyria, until this day.
content_old: 23 until that Yahweh removed Israel from his presence, according as he spake through all his servants the prophets,—and so Israel was driven away from off their own soil､ to Assyria, until this day.

content: 24 And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon､ and from Cuthah､ and from Avvah､ and from Hamath､ and from Sepharvaim, and caused them to dwell in the cities of Samaria, instead of the sons of Israel,—so they took possession of Samaria, and dwelt in the cities thereof.
content_old: 24 And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon､ and from Cuthah､ and from Avvah､ and from Hamath､ and from Sepharvaim, and caused them to dwell in the cities of Samaria, instead of the sons of Israel,—so they took possession of Samaria, and dwelt in the cities thereof.

content: 25 And so it was､ that when they first dwelt there they revered not Yahweh,—therefore Yahweh sent among them､ lions, which were slaying them.
content_old: 25 And so it was､ that when they first dwelt there they revered not Yahweh,—therefore Yahweh sent among them､ lions, which were slaying them.

content: 26 Therefore spake they unto the king of Assyria､ saying, The nations whom thou hast removed and settled in the cities of Samaria know not the custom of the God of the land,—and he hath sent among them lions､ and lo! they are slaying them, because they know not the custom of the God of the land.
content_old: 26 Therefore spake they unto the king of Assyria､ saying, The nations whom thou hast removed and settled in the cities of Samaria know not the custom of the God of the land,—and he hath sent among them lions､ and lo! they are slaying them, because they know not the custom of the God of the land.

content: 27 So the king of Assyria commanded､ saying— Carry thither､ one of the priests､ whom ye brought away captive from thence, that they may go､ and dwell there,—and teach them the custom of the God of the land.
content_old: 27 So the king of Assyria commanded､ saying— Carry thither､ one of the priests､ whom ye brought away captive from thence, that they may go､ and dwell there,—and teach them the custom of the God of the land.

content: 28 Then came one of the priests whom they had carried away captive from Samaria, and dwelt in Bethel,—and he began teaching them how they should do reverence unto Yahweh.
content_old: 28 Then came one of the priests whom they had carried away captive from Samaria, and dwelt in Bethel,—and he began teaching them how they should do reverence unto Yahweh.

content: 29 Howbeit the nations severally were making their own gods,—and did put them in the houses of the high places､ which the Samaritans had made, each several nation in their cities wherein they were dwelling.
content_old: 29 Howbeit the nations severally were making their own gods,—and did put them in the houses of the high places､ which the Samaritans had made, each several nation in their cities wherein they were dwelling.

content: 30 So then the men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth､ and the men of Cuth made Nergal､ and the men of Hamath made Ashima:
content_old: 30 So then the men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth､ and the men of Cuth made Nergal､ and the men of Hamath made Ashima:

content: 31 and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak､ and the Sepharvites did consume their sons in the fire, to Adrammelech and Anammelech gods of Sepharvaim.
content_old: 31 and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak､ and the Sepharvites did consume their sons in the fire, to Adrammelech and Anammelech gods of Sepharvaim.

content: 32 Thus became they reverers of Yahweh,—and yet made for themselves､ from the whole compass of them､ priests of high places, who became offerers for them in the house of the high places.
content_old: 32 Thus became they reverers of Yahweh,—and yet made for themselves､ from the whole compass of them､ priests of high places, who became offerers for them in the house of the high places.

content: 33 Yahweh were they revering,—and yet their own gods were they serving, according to the custom of the nations from whence they had brought them away captive.
content_old: 33 Yahweh were they revering,—and yet their own gods were they serving, according to the custom of the nations from whence they had brought them away captive.

content: 34 Unto this day are they offering according to the former customs,—they are not revering Yahweh, neither are they offering after their own statutes､ or their own custom, nor yet after the law and the commandment which Yahweh commanded the sons of Jacob, Whose name he made to be Israel:
content_old: 34 Unto this day are they offering according to the former customs,—they are not revering Yahweh, neither are they offering after their own statutes､ or their own custom, nor yet after the law and the commandment which Yahweh commanded the sons of Jacob, Whose name he made to be Israel:

content: 35 With whom Yahweh solemnised a covenant, and commanded them､ saying— Ye shall not revere other gods,— nor bow down to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them;
content_old: 35 With whom Yahweh solemnised a covenant, and commanded them､ saying— Ye shall not revere other gods,— nor bow down to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them;

content: 36 But Yahweh— Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt､ with great might､ and with arm outstretched Him shall ye revere,—and To him shall ye bow down､ and To him shall ye sacrifice;
content_old: 36 But Yahweh— Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt､ with great might､ and with arm outstretched Him shall ye revere,—and To him shall ye bow down､ and To him shall ye sacrifice;

content: 37 And the statutes and the regulations､ and the law and the commandment､ which he wrote for you shall ye surely observe to do､ continually,— So shall ye not revere other gods;
content_old: 37 And the statutes and the regulations､ and the law and the commandment､ which he wrote for you shall ye surely observe to do､ continually,— So shall ye not revere other gods;

content: 38 But the covenant which I have solemnised with you shall ye not forget,— So shall ye not revere other gods;
content_old: 38 But the covenant which I have solemnised with you shall ye not forget,— So shall ye not revere other gods;

content: 39 But Yahweh your God shall ye revere,— Then will he deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.
content_old: 39 But Yahweh your God shall ye revere,— Then will he deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.

content: 40 Howbeit they hearkened not,—but according to their own former custom were they offering.
content_old: 40 Howbeit they hearkened not,—but according to their own former custom were they offering.

content: 1 And it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of lsrael that Hezekiah son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of lsrael that Hezekiah son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.

content: 2 Twenty-five years old was he when he began to reign, and twenty-nine years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Abi､ daughter of Zachariah.
content_old: 2 Twenty-five years old was he when he began to reign, and twenty-nine years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Abi､ daughter of Zachariah.

content: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that David his father did.
content_old: 3 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that David his father did.

content: 4 He removed the high places､ and brake in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Sacred Stem,— and beat in pieces the serpent of bronze that Moses had made､ because until those days had the sons of Israel been burning incense thereunto, so he called it Nehushtan.
content_old: 4 He removed the high places､ and brake in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Sacred Stem,— and beat in pieces the serpent of bronze that Moses had made､ because until those days had the sons of Israel been burning incense thereunto, so he called it Nehushtan.

content: 5 In Yahweh､ God of Israel did he trust,—so that after him was none like him､ among all the kings of Judah, nor that were before him;
content_old: 5 In Yahweh､ God of Israel did he trust,—so that after him was none like him､ among all the kings of Judah, nor that were before him;

content: 6 and he did cleave unto Yahweh, he turned not away from following him,—but kept his commandments, which Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 6 and he did cleave unto Yahweh, he turned not away from following him,—but kept his commandments, which Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 7 So Yahweh was with him, whithersoever he went forth he prospered,—and he rebelled against the king of Assyria､ and served him not.
content_old: 7 So Yahweh was with him, whithersoever he went forth he prospered,—and he rebelled against the king of Assyria､ and served him not.

content: 8 He smote the Philistines､ as far as Gazah､ and her boundaries,—from the watchmen’s tower even to the fortified city.
content_old: 8 He smote the Philistines､ as far as Gazah､ and her boundaries,—from the watchmen’s tower even to the fortified city.

content: 9 And it came to pass in the fourth year of King Hezekiah—the same was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria､ and laid siege against it;
content_old: 9 And it came to pass in the fourth year of King Hezekiah—the same was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria､ and laid siege against it;

content: 10 and he captured it at the end of three years, in the sixth year of Hezekiah,—the same is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel was Samaria captured.
content_old: 10 and he captured it at the end of three years, in the sixth year of Hezekiah,—the same is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel was Samaria captured.

content: 11 So the king of Assyria, drave away Israel to Assyria,—and settled them in Halah､ and in Habor､ by the river of Gozan､ and the mountains of Media:
content_old: 11 So the king of Assyria, drave away Israel to Assyria,—and settled them in Halah､ and in Habor､ by the river of Gozan､ and the mountains of Media:

content: 12 because they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh their God, but transgressed his covenant, all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded,—they neither hearkened nor performed.
content_old: 12 because they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh their God, but transgressed his covenant, all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded,—they neither hearkened nor performed.

content: 13 And in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah came up Sennacherib king of Assyria､ against all the fortified cities of Judah､ and took them.
content_old: 13 And in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah came up Sennacherib king of Assyria､ against all the fortified cities of Judah､ and took them.

content: 14 Then sent Hezekiah king of Judah unto the king of Assyria､ to Lachish､ saying— I have sinned､ Return from me, What thou shalt lay upon me I will bear. So the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ three hundred talents of silver, and thirty talents of gold.
content_old: 14 Then sent Hezekiah king of Judah unto the king of Assyria､ to Lachish､ saying— I have sinned､ Return from me, What thou shalt lay upon me I will bear. So the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ three hundred talents of silver, and thirty talents of gold.

content: 15 And Hezekiah delivered up all the silver that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasuries of the house of the king.
content_old: 15 And Hezekiah delivered up all the silver that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasuries of the house of the king.

content: 16 At that time Hezekiah cut off the doors of the temple of Yahweh､ and the columns, which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid,—and gave them unto the king of Assyria.
content_old: 16 At that time Hezekiah cut off the doors of the temple of Yahweh､ and the columns, which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid,—and gave them unto the king of Assyria.

content: 17 And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rab-saris and Rab-shakeh､ from Lachish unto King Hezekiah､ with a heavy force to Jerusalem,—so they came up and drew near to Jerusalem､ and took their stand by the upper channel of the pool, which is in the highway of the fuller’s field.
content_old: 17 And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rab-saris and Rab-shakeh､ from Lachish unto King Hezekiah､ with a heavy force to Jerusalem,—so they came up and drew near to Jerusalem､ and took their stand by the upper channel of the pool, which is in the highway of the fuller’s field.

content: 18 Then called they for the king, and there went out unto them Eliakim son of Hilkiah､ who was over the household,—and Shebnah､ the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph､ the recorder.
content_old: 18 Then called they for the king, and there went out unto them Eliakim son of Hilkiah､ who was over the household,—and Shebnah､ the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph､ the recorder.

content: 19 And Rab-shakeh said unto them— Pray you､ say unto Hezekiah,— Thus saith the great king､ the king of Assyria, What truht is this wherewith thou dost trust?
content_old: 19 And Rab-shakeh said unto them— Pray you､ say unto Hezekiah,— Thus saith the great king､ the king of Assyria, What truht is this wherewith thou dost trust?

content: 20 Thou hast said—they are only words of the lips!— Counsel and might have I for the war. Now in whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me?
content_old: 20 Thou hast said—they are only words of the lips!— Counsel and might have I for the war. Now in whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me?

content: 21 Now lo! thou dost trust thyself on the support of this bruised cane､ on Egypt, whereon if a man lean it will enter his hand and lay it open,—so is Pharaoh king of Egypt, to all who trust upon him.
content_old: 21 Now lo! thou dost trust thyself on the support of this bruised cane､ on Egypt, whereon if a man lean it will enter his hand and lay it open,—so is Pharaoh king of Egypt, to all who trust upon him.

content: 22 But if ye should say unto me, In Yahweh our God do we trust Then is that not he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath removed, and said unto Judah､ and unto Jerusalem— Before this altar shall ye bow down､ in Jerusalem?
content_old: 22 But if ye should say unto me, In Yahweh our God do we trust Then is that not he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath removed, and said unto Judah､ and unto Jerusalem— Before this altar shall ye bow down､ in Jerusalem?

content: 23 Now therefore､ pledge thyself､ I pray thee､ with my lord､ the king of Assyria,— That I supply thee with two thousand horses, If thou､ on thy part､ be able to set riders upon them.
content_old: 23 Now therefore､ pledge thyself､ I pray thee､ with my lord､ the king of Assyria,— That I supply thee with two thousand horses, If thou､ on thy part､ be able to set riders upon them.

content: 24 How then wilt thou turn back the face of one pasha of the least of my lord’s servants? Or hast thou､ on thy part､ trusted to Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
content_old: 24 How then wilt thou turn back the face of one pasha of the least of my lord’s servants? Or hast thou､ on thy part､ trusted to Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

content: 25 Now is it without Yahweh that I have come up against this place､ to destroy it? Yahweh himself said unto me, Go thou up against this land､ and destroy it.
content_old: 25 Now is it without Yahweh that I have come up against this place､ to destroy it? Yahweh himself said unto me, Go thou up against this land､ and destroy it.

content: 26 Then said Eliakim son of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah､ unto Rab-shakeh: Speak､ we pray thee､ unto thy servants in the Syrian language, for we can understand it,— And do not speak with us in the Jews’ language, in the ears of the people who are upon the wall.
content_old: 26 Then said Eliakim son of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah､ unto Rab-shakeh: Speak､ we pray thee､ unto thy servants in the Syrian language, for we can understand it,— And do not speak with us in the Jews’ language, in the ears of the people who are upon the wall.

content: 27 But Rab-shakeh said unto them— Is it concerning thy lord, and concerning thee that my lord hath sent me to speak these things? Is it not concerning the men who are tarrying upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung and drink their own water with you?
content_old: 27 But Rab-shakeh said unto them— Is it concerning thy lord, and concerning thee that my lord hath sent me to speak these things? Is it not concerning the men who are tarrying upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung and drink their own water with you?

content: 28 So then Rab-shakeh took his stand, and cried out with a loud voice､ in the Jews’ language,—and spake､ and said, Hear ye the message of the great king､ the king of Assyria:—
content_old: 28 So then Rab-shakeh took his stand, and cried out with a loud voice､ in the Jews’ language,—and spake､ and said, Hear ye the message of the great king､ the king of Assyria:—

content: 29 Thus saith the king: Let not Hezekiah deceive you, for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand;
content_old: 29 Thus saith the king: Let not Hezekiah deceive you, for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand;

content: 30 Neither let Hezekiah cause you to trust in Yahweh､ saying, Yahweh will certainly deliver us,—this city､ therefore､ shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 30 Neither let Hezekiah cause you to trust in Yahweh､ saying, Yahweh will certainly deliver us,—this city､ therefore､ shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.

content: 31 Do not hearken unto Hezekiah,—for thus saith the king of Assyria､ Deal with me thankfully, and come out unto me, Then shall ye eat— Every one of his own vine､ And every one of his own fig-tree, And drink every one the waters of his own cistern;
content_old: 31 Do not hearken unto Hezekiah,—for thus saith the king of Assyria､ Deal with me thankfully, and come out unto me, Then shall ye eat— Every one of his own vine､ And every one of his own fig-tree, And drink every one the waters of his own cistern;

content: 32 Until I come and take you､ into a land like your own land— A land of corn and new wine､ A land of bread and vineyards､ A land of oil olive and honey, So shall ye live､ and not die,— But do not hearken unto Hezekiah, For he would persuade you､ saying, Yahweh will deliver us!
content_old: 32 Until I come and take you､ into a land like your own land— A land of corn and new wine､ A land of bread and vineyards､ A land of oil olive and honey, So shall ye live､ and not die,— But do not hearken unto Hezekiah, For he would persuade you､ saying, Yahweh will deliver us!

content: 33 Have the gods of the nations at all delivered any one of them､ his country､ out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
content_old: 33 Have the gods of the nations at all delivered any one of them､ his country､ out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

content: 34 Where are the gods of Hamath､ and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim､ Hena and Ivvah? Yea､ did they deliver Samaria out of my hand?
content_old: 34 Where are the gods of Hamath､ and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim､ Hena and Ivvah? Yea､ did they deliver Samaria out of my hand?

content: 35 Who are they､ among all the gods of the countries､ that have delivered their country､ out of my hand,— That Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
content_old: 35 Who are they､ among all the gods of the countries､ that have delivered their country､ out of my hand,— That Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?

content: 36 But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word,—for the command of the king it was､ saying— Ye must not answer him.
content_old: 36 But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word,—for the command of the king it was､ saying— Ye must not answer him.

content: 1 And it came to pass when King Hezekiah heard that he rent his clothes,—and covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when King Hezekiah heard that he rent his clothes,—and covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the house of Yahweh;

content: 2 and sent Eliakim who was over the household､ and Shebna the scribe､ and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth,—unto Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz;
content_old: 2 and sent Eliakim who was over the household､ and Shebna the scribe､ and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth,—unto Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz;

content: 3 and they said unto him— Thus saith Hezekiah, A day of trouble､ and rebuke､ and reviling is this day,— For children are come to the birth, and strength is there none to bring forth!
content_old: 3 and they said unto him— Thus saith Hezekiah, A day of trouble､ and rebuke､ and reviling is this day,— For children are come to the birth, and strength is there none to bring forth!

content: 4 It may be that Yahweh thy God will hear all the words of Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria his lord hath sent､ to reproach a Living God, and will rebuke the words､ which Yahweh thy God hath heard,— Wherefore lift thou up a prayer, for the remnant that remaineth.
content_old: 4 It may be that Yahweh thy God will hear all the words of Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria his lord hath sent､ to reproach a Living God, and will rebuke the words､ which Yahweh thy God hath heard,— Wherefore lift thou up a prayer, for the remnant that remaineth.

content: 5 So the servants of King Hezekiah came unto Isaiah.
content_old: 5 So the servants of King Hezekiah came unto Isaiah.

content: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your lord,— Thus saith Yahweh— Be not thou afraid､ because of the words which thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have reviled me:
content_old: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your lord,— Thus saith Yahweh— Be not thou afraid､ because of the words which thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have reviled me:

content: 7 Behold me! about to let go against him a blast, and when he heareth the report then will he return to his own country,—and I will cause him to fall by the sword､ in his own land.
content_old: 7 Behold me! about to let go against him a blast, and when he heareth the report then will he return to his own country,—and I will cause him to fall by the sword､ in his own land.

content: 8 So Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah,—for he had heard that he had broken up from Lachish.
content_old: 8 So Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah,—for he had heard that he had broken up from Lachish.

content: 9 And when he heard say of Tirhakah､ king of Ethiopia､ saying, Lo! he hath come forth to fight with thee,—then he again sent messengers unto Hezekiah､ saying—
content_old: 9 And when he heard say of Tirhakah､ king of Ethiopia､ saying, Lo! he hath come forth to fight with thee,—then he again sent messengers unto Hezekiah､ saying—

content: 10 Thus shall ye speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ saying— Let not thy God in whom thou art trusting beguile thee､ saying,— Jerusalem shall not be given over, into the hand of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 10 Thus shall ye speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ saying— Let not thy God in whom thou art trusting beguile thee､ saying,— Jerusalem shall not be given over, into the hand of the king of Assyria.

content: 11 Lo! thou thyself hast heard､ what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands､ in devoting them to destruction,—and shalt thou be delivered?
content_old: 11 Lo! thou thyself hast heard､ what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands､ in devoting them to destruction,—and shalt thou be delivered?

content: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed, Gozan､ and Haran,—and Rezeph､ and the sons of Eden､ who were in Telassar?
content_old: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed, Gozan､ and Haran,—and Rezeph､ and the sons of Eden､ who were in Telassar?

content: 13 Where are the king of Hamath､ and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim,—of Hena､ and Ivvah?
content_old: 13 Where are the king of Hamath､ and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim,—of Hena､ and Ivvah?

content: 14 And when Hezekiah had received the letter at the hand of the messengers､ and had read it then went he up to the house of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before Yahweh.
content_old: 14 And when Hezekiah had received the letter at the hand of the messengers､ and had read it then went he up to the house of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before Yahweh.

content: 15 And Hezekiah prayed before Yahweh､ and said, O Yahweh､ God of Israel､ inhabiting the cherubim, Thou thyself art GOD､ alone, for all the kingdoms of the earth,— Thou didst make the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 15 And Hezekiah prayed before Yahweh､ and said, O Yahweh､ God of Israel､ inhabiting the cherubim, Thou thyself art GOD､ alone, for all the kingdoms of the earth,— Thou didst make the heavens and the earth.

content: 16 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear､ and hear, Open､ O Yahweh､ thine eyes､ and see,— Yea hear thou the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent—To reproach a Living God!
content_old: 16 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear､ and hear, Open､ O Yahweh､ thine eyes､ and see,— Yea hear thou the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent—To reproach a Living God!

content: 17 Of a truth O Yahweh,—the kings of Assyria have devoted to destruction the nations and their lands;
content_old: 17 Of a truth O Yahweh,—the kings of Assyria have devoted to destruction the nations and their lands;

content: 18 and have put their gods in the fire,—for no-gods were they､ but the work of the hands of men—wood and stone､ and so they destroyed them.
content_old: 18 and have put their gods in the fire,—for no-gods were they､ but the work of the hands of men—wood and stone､ and so they destroyed them.

content: 19 Now therefore､ O Yahweh our God, save us we pray thee､ out of his hand, That all the kingdoms of the earth may know, That thou､ Yahweh art God､ alone!
content_old: 19 Now therefore､ O Yahweh our God, save us we pray thee､ out of his hand, That all the kingdoms of the earth may know, That thou､ Yahweh art God､ alone!

content: 20 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah､ saying,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, What thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.
content_old: 20 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah､ saying,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, What thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

content: 21 This is the word that Yahweh hath spoken concerning him,— The virgin daughter of Zion laugheth thee to scorn､ mocketh thee, The daughter of Jerusalem after thee doth wag her head.
content_old: 21 This is the word that Yahweh hath spoken concerning him,— The virgin daughter of Zion laugheth thee to scorn､ mocketh thee, The daughter of Jerusalem after thee doth wag her head.

content: 22 Whom hast thou reproached､ and insulted? And against whom hast thou lifted high thy voice? Yea thou hast proudly raised thine eyes､ against the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 22 Whom hast thou reproached､ and insulted? And against whom hast thou lifted high thy voice? Yea thou hast proudly raised thine eyes､ against the Holy One of Israel.

content: 23 Through thy messengers thou hast reproached My Lord, and hast said— With my multitude of chariots have I ascended The height of the mountains､ The recesses of Lebanon,— And have cut down Its tallest cedars､ Its choicest firs, And have entered The shelter of its summit, Its thick garden forests.
content_old: 23 Through thy messengers thou hast reproached My Lord, and hast said— With my multitude of chariots have I ascended The height of the mountains､ The recesses of Lebanon,— And have cut down Its tallest cedars､ Its choicest firs, And have entered The shelter of its summit, Its thick garden forests.

content: 24 I have digged, and have drunk foreign waters,— And have dried up､ with the soles of my feet､ all the streams of besieged places.
content_old: 24 I have digged, and have drunk foreign waters,— And have dried up､ with the soles of my feet､ all the streams of besieged places.

content: 25 Hast thou not heard— That long ago that is what I appointed, And from days of old devised it? Now have I brought it to pass, That thou mightest serve to lay waste､ in desolate ruins fortified cities;
content_old: 25 Hast thou not heard— That long ago that is what I appointed, And from days of old devised it? Now have I brought it to pass, That thou mightest serve to lay waste､ in desolate ruins fortified cities;

content: 26 And their inhabitants､ being powerless were overthrown and put to shame,— They became Grass of the field､ and Young herbage, Grass on housetops, and Seed withered before it came up.
content_old: 26 And their inhabitants､ being powerless were overthrown and put to shame,— They became Grass of the field､ and Young herbage, Grass on housetops, and Seed withered before it came up.

content: 27 Howbeit thine abode､ and thy coming out and thy going in I know,—and thy raging against me.
content_old: 27 Howbeit thine abode､ and thy coming out and thy going in I know,—and thy raging against me.

content: 28 Because thy raging against me, and thy contempt have come up into mine ears Therefore will I put My ring in thy nose､ and My bit in thy lips, And will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
content_old: 28 Because thy raging against me, and thy contempt have come up into mine ears Therefore will I put My ring in thy nose､ and My bit in thy lips, And will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

content: 29 And this unto thee is the sign— Eating this year the growth of scattered seeds, And in the second year that which groweth after,— Then in the third year Sow ye and reap､ Plant ye vineyards､ and eat the fruit thereof;
content_old: 29 And this unto thee is the sign— Eating this year the growth of scattered seeds, And in the second year that which groweth after,— Then in the third year Sow ye and reap､ Plant ye vineyards､ and eat the fruit thereof;

content: 30 Then shall the escaped of the house of Judah that remain､ again— Take root downward, And bear fruit upward;
content_old: 30 Then shall the escaped of the house of Judah that remain､ again— Take root downward, And bear fruit upward;

content: 31 For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, And that which hath escaped—out of Mount Zion,— The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this.
content_old: 31 For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, And that which hath escaped—out of Mount Zion,— The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this.

content: 32 Therefore— Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not enter this city, Nor shoot there､ an arrow,— Nor attack it with shield, Nor cast up against it､ a mound;
content_old: 32 Therefore— Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not enter this city, Nor shoot there､ an arrow,— Nor attack it with shield, Nor cast up against it､ a mound;

content: 33 By the way that he cometh in By the same shall he return,— And into this city shall he not enter､ Declareth Yahweh!
content_old: 33 By the way that he cometh in By the same shall he return,— And into this city shall he not enter､ Declareth Yahweh!

content: 34 Thus will I throw a covering over this city､ to save it,— For mine own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.
content_old: 34 Thus will I throw a covering over this city､ to save it,— For mine own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.

content: 35 And it came to pass during that night that the messenger of Yahweh went forth､ and smote､ in the camp of the Assyrians､ a hundred and eighty-five thousand. And when men arose early in the morning lo! they were all dead bodies!
content_old: 35 And it came to pass during that night that the messenger of Yahweh went forth､ and smote､ in the camp of the Assyrians､ a hundred and eighty-five thousand. And when men arose early in the morning lo! they were all dead bodies!

content: 36 So Sennacherib king of Assyria brake up､ and went his way, and returned,—and remained in Nineveh.
content_old: 36 So Sennacherib king of Assyria brake up､ and went his way, and returned,—and remained in Nineveh.

content: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick､ unto death,—and Isaiah son of Amoz､ the prophet､ came unto him, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ Set in order thy house, for about to die thou art､ and shalt not recover.
content_old: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick､ unto death,—and Isaiah son of Amoz､ the prophet､ came unto him, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ Set in order thy house, for about to die thou art､ and shalt not recover.

content: 2 Then he turned his face unto the wall,—and prayed unto Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 2 Then he turned his face unto the wall,—and prayed unto Yahweh､ saying:

content: 3 I beseech thee､ O Yahweh､ remember､ I pray thee､ how I have walked before thee､ in truth､ and with a whole heart, and that which is good in thine eyes have I done! And Hezekiah wept aloud.
content_old: 3 I beseech thee､ O Yahweh､ remember､ I pray thee､ how I have walked before thee､ in truth､ and with a whole heart, and that which is good in thine eyes have I done! And Hezekiah wept aloud.

content: 4 And it came to pass that Isaiah had not gone out into the middle court when the word of Yahweh came unto him､ saying:
content_old: 4 And it came to pass that Isaiah had not gone out into the middle court when the word of Yahweh came unto him､ saying:

content: 5 Return､ and thou shalt say unto Hezekiah the leader of my people— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears,— Behold me! about to heal thee, On the third day shalt thou go up unto the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 5 Return､ and thou shalt say unto Hezekiah the leader of my people— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears,— Behold me! about to heal thee, On the third day shalt thou go up unto the house of Yahweh;

content: 6 And I will add unto thy days､ fifteen years, And out of the hand of the king of Assyria will I deliver thee, and this city,— And will throw a covering over this city, For my own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.
content_old: 6 And I will add unto thy days､ fifteen years, And out of the hand of the king of Assyria will I deliver thee, and this city,— And will throw a covering over this city, For my own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.

content: 7 And Isaiah said— Take ye a cake of figs. So they took and laid it upon the boil､ and he recovered.
content_old: 7 And Isaiah said— Take ye a cake of figs. So they took and laid it upon the boil､ and he recovered.

content: 8 Now Hezekiah had said unto Isaiah, What sign is there､ that Yahweh will heal me,—and that I shall go up on the third day､ to the house of Yahweh?
content_old: 8 Now Hezekiah had said unto Isaiah, What sign is there､ that Yahweh will heal me,—and that I shall go up on the third day､ to the house of Yahweh?

content: 9 And Isaiah said— This unto thee is the sign from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do the thing which he hath spoken,— The shadow hath gone forward ten steps, shall it return ten steps?
content_old: 9 And Isaiah said— This unto thee is the sign from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do the thing which he hath spoken,— The shadow hath gone forward ten steps, shall it return ten steps?

content: 10 And Hezekiah said— It is a light thing for the shadow, to decline ten steps,— Nay, but let the shadow go back ten steps.
content_old: 10 And Hezekiah said— It is a light thing for the shadow, to decline ten steps,— Nay, but let the shadow go back ten steps.

content: 11 And Isaiah the prophet cried unto Yahweh,—and he caused the shadow on the steps by which it had gone down on the steps of Ahaz to go back､ ten steps.
content_old: 11 And Isaiah the prophet cried unto Yahweh,—and he caused the shadow on the steps by which it had gone down on the steps of Ahaz to go back､ ten steps.

content: 12 At that time Berodach-baladan son of Baladan､ king of Babylon､ sent letters and a present､ unto Hezekiah,—for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
content_old: 12 At that time Berodach-baladan son of Baladan､ king of Babylon､ sent letters and a present､ unto Hezekiah,—for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

content: 13 And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all his house of precious things—the silver､ and the gold､ and the spices､ and the precious ointment､ and his armoury, and all that was found among his treasures,—there was nothing that Hezekiah shewed them not､ in his house or in all his dominion.
content_old: 13 And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all his house of precious things—the silver､ and the gold､ and the spices､ and the precious ointment､ and his armoury, and all that was found among his treasures,—there was nothing that Hezekiah shewed them not､ in his house or in all his dominion.

content: 14 Then came Isaiah the prophet unto King Hezekiah,—and said unto him— What said these men､ and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, From a land far off came they—from Babylon.
content_old: 14 Then came Isaiah the prophet unto King Hezekiah,—and said unto him— What said these men､ and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, From a land far off came they—from Babylon.

content: 15 And he said— What have they seen in thy house? Then said Hezekiah— All that is in my house have they seen, there was nothing that I shewed them not､ among my treasures.
content_old: 15 And he said— What have they seen in thy house? Then said Hezekiah— All that is in my house have they seen, there was nothing that I shewed them not､ among my treasures.

content: 16 Then said Isaiah unto Hezekiah,— Hear thou the word of Yahweh:
content_old: 16 Then said Isaiah unto Hezekiah,— Hear thou the word of Yahweh:

content: 17 Lo! days are coming, when all that is in thine house､ and that thy fathers have treasured up､ unto this day､ shall be carried into Babylon,—nothing shall be left､ saith Yahweh;
content_old: 17 Lo! days are coming, when all that is in thine house､ and that thy fathers have treasured up､ unto this day､ shall be carried into Babylon,—nothing shall be left､ saith Yahweh;

content: 18 and of thy sons who shall issue from thee､ whom thou shalt beget shall they take away,—and they shall become eunuchs, in the palace of the king of Babylon.
content_old: 18 and of thy sons who shall issue from thee､ whom thou shalt beget shall they take away,—and they shall become eunuchs, in the palace of the king of Babylon.

content: 19 And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah— Good is the word of Yahweh､ which thou hast spoken. And he said— Is it not､ that peace and stability there shall be in my days?
content_old: 19 And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah— Good is the word of Yahweh､ which thou hast spoken. And he said— Is it not､ that peace and stability there shall be in my days?

content: 20 Now the rest of the story of Hezekiah､ and all his might, and how he made a pool and an aqueduct, and brought water into the city are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 20 Now the rest of the story of Hezekiah､ and all his might, and how he made a pool and an aqueduct, and brought water into the city are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 1 Twelve years old was Manasseh when he began to reign, and fifty-five years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Hephzibah.
content_old: 1 Twelve years old was Manasseh when he began to reign, and fifty-five years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and the name of his mother was Hephzibah.

content: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—after the abominable practices of the nations, whom Yahweh had dispossessed from before the sons of Israel.
content_old: 2 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—after the abominable practices of the nations, whom Yahweh had dispossessed from before the sons of Israel.

content: 3 He again built the high places, which Hezekiah his father had destroyed,—and reared altars to Baal､ and made a Sacred Stem､ as did Ahab､ king of Israel, and bowed down to all the army of the heavens, and served them.
content_old: 3 He again built the high places, which Hezekiah his father had destroyed,—and reared altars to Baal､ and made a Sacred Stem､ as did Ahab､ king of Israel, and bowed down to all the army of the heavens, and served them.

content: 4 And he used to build altars in the house of Yahweh,—concerning which Yahweh had said,— In Jerusalem will I put my Name.
content_old: 4 And he used to build altars in the house of Yahweh,—concerning which Yahweh had said,— In Jerusalem will I put my Name.

content: 5 And he built altars to all the army of the heavens,—in the two courts of the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 5 And he built altars to all the army of the heavens,—in the two courts of the house of Yahweh;

content: 6 and caused his son to pass through the fire, and practised hidden arts and used divination, and dealt with a familiar spirit and wizards,—he exceeded in doing the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ provoking him to anger;
content_old: 6 and caused his son to pass through the fire, and practised hidden arts and used divination, and dealt with a familiar spirit and wizards,—he exceeded in doing the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ provoking him to anger;

content: 7 and he set the image of the Sacred Stem which he had made,—in the house､ of which Yahweh had said unto David､ and unto Solomon his son, In this house､ and in Jerusalem which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel will I put my Name､ unto times age-abiding;
content_old: 7 and he set the image of the Sacred Stem which he had made,—in the house､ of which Yahweh had said unto David､ and unto Solomon his son, In this house､ and in Jerusalem which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel will I put my Name､ unto times age-abiding;

content: 8 and I will not again let the foot of Israel wander away from the soil which I gave unto their fathers. Only if they take heed to do according to all that I have commanded them, even to the extent of all the law which my servant Moses commanded them.
content_old: 8 and I will not again let the foot of Israel wander away from the soil which I gave unto their fathers. Only if they take heed to do according to all that I have commanded them, even to the extent of all the law which my servant Moses commanded them.

content: 9 But they hearkened not,—and Manasseh led them astray to do the thing that was wicked, more than the nations which Yahweh destroyed from before the sons of Israel.
content_old: 9 But they hearkened not,—and Manasseh led them astray to do the thing that was wicked, more than the nations which Yahweh destroyed from before the sons of Israel.

content: 10 Yahweh therefore spake through his servants the prophets､ saying—
content_old: 10 Yahweh therefore spake through his servants the prophets､ saying—

content: 11 Because Manasseh king of Judah hath made these abominations—hath done that which is wicked､ more than all which the Amorites did who were before him, and and hath caused even Judah to sin with his manufactured gods
content_old: 11 Because Manasseh king of Judah hath made these abominations—hath done that which is wicked､ more than all which the Amorites did who were before him, and and hath caused even Judah to sin with his manufactured gods

content: 12 therefore— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Behold me! bringing in calamity upon Jerusalem and Judah,—that whosoever heareth thereof both his ears will tingle;
content_old: 12 therefore— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Behold me! bringing in calamity upon Jerusalem and Judah,—that whosoever heareth thereof both his ears will tingle;

content: 13 And I will stretch over Jerusalem､ the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab,— And will wipe out Jerusalem､ as one wipeth out a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down;
content_old: 13 And I will stretch over Jerusalem､ the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab,— And will wipe out Jerusalem､ as one wipeth out a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down;

content: 14 And will abandon the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies,—and they shall become a prey and a plunder､ to all their enemies:
content_old: 14 And will abandon the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies,—and they shall become a prey and a plunder､ to all their enemies:

content: 15 Because they have done the thing that is wicked in mine eyes, and have become such as to provoke me to anger,—from the day when their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even until this day.
content_old: 15 Because they have done the thing that is wicked in mine eyes, and have become such as to provoke me to anger,—from the day when their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even until this day.

content: 16 Moreover also innocent blood did Manasseh shed in great abundance, till he had filled Jerusalem､ from one end to the other, besides his committing the sins which he caused Judah to commit, in doing the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh.
content_old: 16 Moreover also innocent blood did Manasseh shed in great abundance, till he had filled Jerusalem､ from one end to the other, besides his committing the sins which he caused Judah to commit, in doing the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh.

content: 17 Now the rest of the story of Manasseh､ and all that he did, and his sin that he committed are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 17 Now the rest of the story of Manasseh､ and all that he did, and his sin that he committed are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 18 And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house､ in the garden of Uzza,—and Amôn his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 18 And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house､ in the garden of Uzza,—and Amôn his son reigned in his stead.

content: 19 Twenty-two years old was Amôn when he began to reign, and two years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz､ of Jotbah.
content_old: 19 Twenty-two years old was Amôn when he began to reign, and two years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz､ of Jotbah.

content: 20 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—as did Manasseh his father;
content_old: 20 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—as did Manasseh his father;

content: 21 yea he walked in all the way wherein his father had walked,—and served the manufactured gods that his father had served, and bowed down to them;
content_old: 21 yea he walked in all the way wherein his father had walked,—and served the manufactured gods that his father had served, and bowed down to them;

content: 22 and forsook Yahweh the God of his fathers,—and walked not in the way of Yahweh.
content_old: 22 and forsook Yahweh the God of his fathers,—and walked not in the way of Yahweh.

content: 23 And the servants of Amôn conspired against him,—and slew the king in his own house.
content_old: 23 And the servants of Amôn conspired against him,—and slew the king in his own house.

content: 24 Then the people of the land smote all who had conspired against King Amôn,—and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
content_old: 24 Then the people of the land smote all who had conspired against King Amôn,—and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.

content: 25 Now the rest of the story of Amôn､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 25 Now the rest of the story of Amôn､ what he did is it not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 1 Eight years old was Josiah when he began to reign, and thirty-one years reigned he in Jerusalem;—and his mother’s name was Jedidah daughter of Adaiah､ of Bozkath.
content_old: 1 Eight years old was Josiah when he began to reign, and thirty-one years reigned he in Jerusalem;—and his mother’s name was Jedidah daughter of Adaiah､ of Bozkath.

content: 2 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside､ to the right hand or to the left.
content_old: 2 And he did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh,—and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside､ to the right hand or to the left.

content: 3 And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of King Josiah that the king sent Shaphan son of Azaliah son of Meshullam､ the scribe, to the house of Yahweh､ saying—
content_old: 3 And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of King Josiah that the king sent Shaphan son of Azaliah son of Meshullam､ the scribe, to the house of Yahweh､ saying—

content: 4 Go up unto Hilkiah､ the high priest, that he pour out the silver that hath been brought into the house of Yahweh,—which the keepers of the entrance-hall have gathered from the people,
content_old: 4 Go up unto Hilkiah､ the high priest, that he pour out the silver that hath been brought into the house of Yahweh,—which the keepers of the entrance-hall have gathered from the people,

content: 5 that they may give it into the hand of the doers of the work, who have oversight of the house of Yahweh, that they may give it to the doers of the work､ who are in the house of Yahweh, to repair the breaches of the house;
content_old: 5 that they may give it into the hand of the doers of the work, who have oversight of the house of Yahweh, that they may give it to the doers of the work､ who are in the house of Yahweh, to repair the breaches of the house;

content: 6 to the carpenters, and to the builders､ and to the masons,—and to buy timber､ and hewn stones, for repairing the house.
content_old: 6 to the carpenters, and to the builders､ and to the masons,—and to buy timber､ and hewn stones, for repairing the house.

content: 7 Howbeit there used to be no reckoning made with them, as to the silver that was given into their hand,—because with faithfulness were they dealing.
content_old: 7 Howbeit there used to be no reckoning made with them, as to the silver that was given into their hand,—because with faithfulness were they dealing.

content: 8 Then said Hilkiah the high priest､ unto Shaphan the scribe— The book of the law have I found､ in the house of Yahweh. So Hilkiah delivered the book unto Shaphan､ and he read it.
content_old: 8 Then said Hilkiah the high priest､ unto Shaphan the scribe— The book of the law have I found､ in the house of Yahweh. So Hilkiah delivered the book unto Shaphan､ and he read it.

content: 9 Then came Shaphan the scribe unto the king, and brought the king word again,—and said— Thy servants have poured out the silver that was found in the house, and have delivered it unto the hand of the doers of the work, who have oversight of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 9 Then came Shaphan the scribe unto the king, and brought the king word again,—and said— Thy servants have poured out the silver that was found in the house, and have delivered it unto the hand of the doers of the work, who have oversight of the house of Yahweh.

content: 10 Then Shaphan the scribe told the king､ saying— A book hath Hilkiah the priest delivered unto me. And Shaphan read it before the king.
content_old: 10 Then Shaphan the scribe told the king､ saying— A book hath Hilkiah the priest delivered unto me. And Shaphan read it before the king.

content: 11 And it came to pass when the king heard the words of the book of the law that he rent his clothes.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass when the king heard the words of the book of the law that he rent his clothes.

content: 12 And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest､ and Ahikam son of Shaphan､ and Achbor son of Micaiah､ and Shaphan the scribe､ and Asaiah the king’s servant､ saying:
content_old: 12 And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest､ and Ahikam son of Shaphan､ and Achbor son of Micaiah､ and Shaphan the scribe､ and Asaiah the king’s servant､ saying:

content: 13 Go ye—enquire of Yahweh､ for me and for the people､ and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book which hath been found,—for great is the wrath of Yahweh, in that it hath fired up against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according to all which is written concerning us.
content_old: 13 Go ye—enquire of Yahweh､ for me and for the people､ and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book which hath been found,—for great is the wrath of Yahweh, in that it hath fired up against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according to all which is written concerning us.

content: 14 So Hilkiah the priest､ and Ahikam､ and Achbor､ and Shaphan､ and Asaiah､ went unto Huldah the prophetess､ wife of Shallum son of Tikvah､ son of Harhas keeper of the vestments, she having her dwelling in Jerusalem､ in the new city,—and they spake unto her.
content_old: 14 So Hilkiah the priest､ and Ahikam､ and Achbor､ and Shaphan､ and Asaiah､ went unto Huldah the prophetess､ wife of Shallum son of Tikvah､ son of Harhas keeper of the vestments, she having her dwelling in Jerusalem､ in the new city,—and they spake unto her.

content: 15 And she said unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Say ye unto the man who hath sent you unto me:
content_old: 15 And she said unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Say ye unto the man who hath sent you unto me:

content: 16 Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! about to bring calamity upon this place､ and upon the inhabitants thereof,—all the words of the book, which the king of Judah hath read:
content_old: 16 Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! about to bring calamity upon this place､ and upon the inhabitants thereof,—all the words of the book, which the king of Judah hath read:

content: 17 Because they have forsaken me､ and burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger, with all the workmanship of their hands; and so my wrath shall fire up against this place､ and shall not be quenched:
content_old: 17 Because they have forsaken me､ and burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger, with all the workmanship of their hands; and so my wrath shall fire up against this place､ and shall not be quenched:

content: 18 But unto the king of Judah､ who hath sent you to enquire of Yahweh thus shall ye say unto him,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, As touching the words which thou hast heard:
content_old: 18 But unto the king of Judah､ who hath sent you to enquire of Yahweh thus shall ye say unto him,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, As touching the words which thou hast heard:

content: 19 Because tender was thy heart､ and thou didst humble thyself before Yahweh when thou heardest what I had spoken against this place and against the inhabitants thereof—that they should become a desolation and a curse, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me therefore also I have hearkened— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 19 Because tender was thy heart､ and thou didst humble thyself before Yahweh when thou heardest what I had spoken against this place and against the inhabitants thereof—that they should become a desolation and a curse, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me therefore also I have hearkened— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 1 Then the king sent,—and there were gathered unto him, all the elders of Judah､ and Jerusalem;
content_old: 1 Then the king sent,—and there were gathered unto him, all the elders of Judah､ and Jerusalem;

content: 2 and the king went up to the house of Yahweh､ and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him､ and the priests､ and the prophets, and all the people､ both small and great,—and he read in their ears､ all the words of the book of the covenant, which had been found in the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 2 and the king went up to the house of Yahweh､ and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him､ and the priests､ and the prophets, and all the people､ both small and great,—and he read in their ears､ all the words of the book of the covenant, which had been found in the house of Yahweh.

content: 3 And the king took his stand by the pillar､ and solemnised a covenant before Yahweh—to follow Yahweh､ and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes､ with all their heart and with all their soul, to confirm the words of this covenant, written in this book. And all the people took their stand in the covenant.
content_old: 3 And the king took his stand by the pillar､ and solemnised a covenant before Yahweh—to follow Yahweh､ and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes､ with all their heart and with all their soul, to confirm the words of this covenant, written in this book. And all the people took their stand in the covenant.

content: 4 Then the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest､ and the priests of the second order､ and the keepers of the entrance-hall, to bring forth､ out of the temple of Yahweh�� all the vessels that had been made for Baal and for the Sacred Stem, and for all the army of the heavens,—and he burned them up outside Jerusalem, in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them to Bethel;
content_old: 4 Then the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest､ and the priests of the second order､ and the keepers of the entrance-hall, to bring forth､ out of the temple of Yahweh�� all the vessels that had been made for Baal and for the Sacred Stem, and for all the army of the heavens,—and he burned them up outside Jerusalem, in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them to Bethel;

content: 5 and he put down the idol-priests､ whom the kings of Judah had appointed, so that incense might be burned in the high places､ in the cities of Judah, and round about Jerusalem,—them also that burned incense to Baal､ to the sun､ and to the moon､ and to the constellations, and to all the army of the heavens;
content_old: 5 and he put down the idol-priests､ whom the kings of Judah had appointed, so that incense might be burned in the high places､ in the cities of Judah, and round about Jerusalem,—them also that burned incense to Baal､ to the sun､ and to the moon､ and to the constellations, and to all the army of the heavens;

content: 6 and he brought forth the Sacred Stem out of the house of Yahweh outside Jerusalem､ into the Kidron ravine, and burned it in the Kidron ravine､ and crushed it to powder,—and cast the powder upon the graves of the sons of the people;
content_old: 6 and he brought forth the Sacred Stem out of the house of Yahweh outside Jerusalem､ into the Kidron ravine, and burned it in the Kidron ravine､ and crushed it to powder,—and cast the powder upon the graves of the sons of the people;

content: 7 and he brake down the houses of the male devotees, which were in the house of Yahweh,—where the women did weave houses to the Sacred Stem;
content_old: 7 and he brake down the houses of the male devotees, which were in the house of Yahweh,—where the women did weave houses to the Sacred Stem;

content: 8 and he brought in all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba unto Beer-sheba,—and brake down the high places of the gates､ that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua､ the governor of the city, which were on one’s left hand､ in the gate of the city;
content_old: 8 and he brought in all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba unto Beer-sheba,—and brake down the high places of the gates､ that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua､ the governor of the city, which were on one’s left hand､ in the gate of the city;

content: 9 howbeit the priests of the high places came not up unto the altar of Yahweh､ in Jerusalem, save only that they did eat unleavened bread in the midst of their brethren;
content_old: 9 howbeit the priests of the high places came not up unto the altar of Yahweh､ in Jerusalem, save only that they did eat unleavened bread in the midst of their brethren;

content: 10 and he defiled Topheth, which was in the valley of the son of Hinnom,—so that no man might cause his son or his daughter to pass through the fire unto Molech;
content_old: 10 and he defiled Topheth, which was in the valley of the son of Hinnom,—so that no man might cause his son or his daughter to pass through the fire unto Molech;

content: 11 and he did away with the horses､ which the kings of Judah had devoted to the sun, at the entrance of the house of Yahweh, near the chamber of Nathan-melech the courtier, which was in the suburbs,—also the chariots of the sun burned he with fire;
content_old: 11 and he did away with the horses､ which the kings of Judah had devoted to the sun, at the entrance of the house of Yahweh, near the chamber of Nathan-melech the courtier, which was in the suburbs,—also the chariots of the sun burned he with fire;

content: 12 and the altars which were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz､ which the kings of Judah had made､ also the altars which Manasseh had made, in the two courts of the house of Yahweh did the king break down,—and hurried away from thence, and cast out the powder of them into the Kidron ravine;
content_old: 12 and the altars which were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz､ which the kings of Judah had made､ also the altars which Manasseh had made, in the two courts of the house of Yahweh did the king break down,—and hurried away from thence, and cast out the powder of them into the Kidron ravine;

content: 13 and the high places that were before Jerusalem､ which were on the right hand of the mount of destruction, which Solomon king of Israel had built unto Ashtoreth—the abomination of the Zidonians､ and unto Chemosh—the abomination of the Moabites､ and unto Milcom—the disgusting thing of the sons of Ammon did the king defile;
content_old: 13 and the high places that were before Jerusalem､ which were on the right hand of the mount of destruction, which Solomon king of Israel had built unto Ashtoreth—the abomination of the Zidonians､ and unto Chemosh—the abomination of the Moabites､ and unto Milcom—the disgusting thing of the sons of Ammon did the king defile;

content: 14 and he brake in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Sacred Stems,—and filled their place with human bones:
content_old: 14 and he brake in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Sacred Stems,—and filled their place with human bones:

content: 15 moreover also the altar that was in Bethel, the high place which Jeroboam son of Nebat made､ wherewith he caused Israel to sin,—even that altar､ and the high place brake he down,—and burned the high place､ crushing it to powder､ and burned a Sacred Stem.
content_old: 15 moreover also the altar that was in Bethel, the high place which Jeroboam son of Nebat made､ wherewith he caused Israel to sin,—even that altar､ and the high place brake he down,—and burned the high place､ crushing it to powder､ and burned a Sacred Stem.

content: 16 And when Josiah turned､ and saw the graves which were there､ in the mount he sent and took the bones out of the graves, and burned upon the altar､ and defiled it,—according to the word of Yahweh､ which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.
content_old: 16 And when Josiah turned､ and saw the graves which were there､ in the mount he sent and took the bones out of the graves, and burned upon the altar､ and defiled it,—according to the word of Yahweh､ which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.

content: 17 Then said he— What is yonder erection, which I do see? And the men of the city said unto him— The grave of the man of God､ who came in out of Judah, and proclaimed these things､ which thou hast done､ concerning the altar of Bethel.
content_old: 17 Then said he— What is yonder erection, which I do see? And the men of the city said unto him— The grave of the man of God､ who came in out of Judah, and proclaimed these things､ which thou hast done､ concerning the altar of Bethel.

content: 18 And he said— Let him rest, let no man disturb his bones. So they let his bones rest, with the bones of the prophet who came in out of Samaria.
content_old: 18 And he said— Let him rest, let no man disturb his bones. So they let his bones rest, with the bones of the prophet who came in out of Samaria.

content: 19 Moreover also all the houses of the high places which were in the cities of Samaria､ which the kings of Israel had made､ so as to provoke Yahweh to anger did Josiah remove,—and he did to them according to all the doings which he had done in Bethel;
content_old: 19 Moreover also all the houses of the high places which were in the cities of Samaria､ which the kings of Israel had made､ so as to provoke Yahweh to anger did Josiah remove,—and he did to them according to all the doings which he had done in Bethel;

content: 20 and he sacrificed all the priests of the high places､ who were there､ by the altars, and burned human bones thereupon,—and returned to Jerusalem.
content_old: 20 and he sacrificed all the priests of the high places､ who were there､ by the altars, and burned human bones thereupon,—and returned to Jerusalem.

content: 21 Then did the king command all the people､ saying, Keep ye a passover unto Yahweh､ your God,—such as is written in this book of the covenant.
content_old: 21 Then did the king command all the people､ saying, Keep ye a passover unto Yahweh､ your God,—such as is written in this book of the covenant.

content: 22 Surely there had not been held such a passover as this, from the days of the Judges who judged Israel,—nor all the days of the kings of Israel､ and the kings of Judah;
content_old: 22 Surely there had not been held such a passover as this, from the days of the Judges who judged Israel,—nor all the days of the kings of Israel､ and the kings of Judah;

content: 23 save only in the eighteenth year of King Josiah when this passover was held unto Yahweh､ in Jerusalem.
content_old: 23 save only in the eighteenth year of King Josiah when this passover was held unto Yahweh､ in Jerusalem.

content: 24 Moreover also them who had familiar spirits､ and the wizards､ and the household gods､ and the manufactured gods､ and the abominations which were to be seen in the land of Judah､ and in Jerusalem did Josiah consume,—that he might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest had found in the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 24 Moreover also them who had familiar spirits､ and the wizards､ and the household gods､ and the manufactured gods､ and the abominations which were to be seen in the land of Judah､ and in Jerusalem did Josiah consume,—that he might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest had found in the house of Yahweh.

content: 25 And like him was no king before him､ who turned unto Yahweh with all his heart､ and with all his soul､ and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses,—neither after him arose one like him.
content_old: 25 And like him was no king before him､ who turned unto Yahweh with all his heart､ and with all his soul､ and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses,—neither after him arose one like him.

content: 26 Howbeit Yahweh turned not away from the glow of his great anger, wherewith his anger glowed against Judah—because of all the provocations wherewith Manasseh had provoked him.
content_old: 26 Howbeit Yahweh turned not away from the glow of his great anger, wherewith his anger glowed against Judah—because of all the provocations wherewith Manasseh had provoked him.

content: 27 So Yahweh said: Even Judah will I remove from my presence, as I have removed Israel,—and will reject this city､ which I had chosen､ even Jerusalem, and the house as to which I had said､ My Name shall be there.
content_old: 27 So Yahweh said: Even Judah will I remove from my presence, as I have removed Israel,—and will reject this city､ which I had chosen､ even Jerusalem, and the house as to which I had said､ My Name shall be there.

content: 28 Now the rest of the story of Josiah､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 28 Now the rest of the story of Josiah､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 29 In his days came up Pharaoh-necoh king of Egypt､ against the king of Assyria, unto the river Euphrates,—and when King Josiah went against him he slew him at Megiddo, as soon as he saw him.
