content_old: 29 In his days came up Pharaoh-necoh king of Egypt､ against the king of Assyria, unto the river Euphrates,—and when King Josiah went against him he slew him at Megiddo, as soon as he saw him.

content: 30 And his servants conveyed him in a chariot､ dead､ from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulchre,—and the people of the land took Jehoahaz､ son of Josiah, and anointed him､ and made him king in his father’s stead.
content_old: 30 And his servants conveyed him in a chariot､ dead､ from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulchre,—and the people of the land took Jehoahaz､ son of Josiah, and anointed him､ and made him king in his father’s stead.

content: 31 Twenty-three years old was Jehoahaz when he began to reign, and three months reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah､ of Libnah.
content_old: 31 Twenty-three years old was Jehoahaz when he began to reign, and three months reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah､ of Libnah.

content: 32 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ according to all that his fathers had done.
content_old: 32 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ according to all that his fathers had done.

content: 33 And Pharaoh-necoh put him in bonds at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem,—and he laid a fine upon the land, a hundred talents of silver､ and a talent of gold.
content_old: 33 And Pharaoh-necoh put him in bonds at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem,—and he laid a fine upon the land, a hundred talents of silver､ and a talent of gold.

content: 34 And Pharaoh-necoh made Eliakim son of Josiah king､ instead of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim,—and Jehoahaz took he away, so he entered Egypt､ and died there.
content_old: 34 And Pharaoh-necoh made Eliakim son of Josiah king､ instead of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim,—and Jehoahaz took he away, so he entered Egypt､ and died there.

content: 35 And the silver and the gold did Jehoiakim give unto Pharaoh, howbeit he assessed the land, that he might give the silver at the bidding of Pharaoh,—every man､ according to his assessment exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, that he might give it to Pharaoh-necoh.
content_old: 35 And the silver and the gold did Jehoiakim give unto Pharaoh, howbeit he assessed the land, that he might give the silver at the bidding of Pharaoh,—every man､ according to his assessment exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, that he might give it to Pharaoh-necoh.

content: 36 Twenty-five years old was Jehoiakim when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Zebudah daughter of Pedaiah､ of Rumah.
content_old: 36 Twenty-five years old was Jehoiakim when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Zebudah daughter of Pedaiah､ of Rumah.

content: 1 In his days came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon,—and Jehoiakim became his servant three years, then turned he and rebelled against him.
content_old: 1 In his days came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon,—and Jehoiakim became his servant three years, then turned he and rebelled against him.

content: 2 And Yahweh sent against him troops of Chaldeans､ and troops of Syrians､ and troops of Moabites､ and troops of the sons of Ammon, yea he sent them against Judah､ to destroy him,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he spake through his servants the prophets.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh sent against him troops of Chaldeans､ and troops of Syrians､ and troops of Moabites､ and troops of the sons of Ammon, yea he sent them against Judah､ to destroy him,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he spake through his servants the prophets.

content: 3 Surely it was because of the anger of Yahweh that this came upon Judah､ to remove them from his presence,—for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he had done:
content_old: 3 Surely it was because of the anger of Yahweh that this came upon Judah､ to remove them from his presence,—for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he had done:

content: 4 moreover also for the innocent blood that he had shed, so that he had filled Jerusalem with innocent blood,—which Yahweh was not willing to pardon.
content_old: 4 moreover also for the innocent blood that he had shed, so that he had filled Jerusalem with innocent blood,—which Yahweh was not willing to pardon.

content: 5 Now the rest of the story of Jehoiakim､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
content_old: 5 Now the rest of the story of Jehoiakim､ and all that he did are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

content: 6 So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers,—and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 6 So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers,—and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.

content: 7 And the king of Egypt came no more again out of his land,—for the king of Babylon had taken—from the ravine of Egypt, unto the river Euphrates, all that had belonged to the king of Egypt.
content_old: 7 And the king of Egypt came no more again out of his land,—for the king of Babylon had taken—from the ravine of Egypt, unto the river Euphrates, all that had belonged to the king of Egypt.

content: 8 Eighteen years old was Jehoiachin when he began to reign, and three months reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan､ of Jerusalem.
content_old: 8 Eighteen years old was Jehoiachin when he began to reign, and three months reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan､ of Jerusalem.

content: 9 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that his father had done.
content_old: 9 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that his father had done.

content: 10 At that time came up the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon､ unto Jerusalem,—and the city came into the siege.
content_old: 10 At that time came up the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon､ unto Jerusalem,—and the city came into the siege.

content: 11 And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants were about to besiege it.
content_old: 11 And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants were about to besiege it.

content: 12 Then came out Jehoiachin king of Judah､ unto the king of Babylon, he and his mother, and his servants､ and his generals､ and his courtiers,—and the king of Babylon took him, in the eighth year of his reign.
content_old: 12 Then came out Jehoiachin king of Judah､ unto the king of Babylon, he and his mother, and his servants､ and his generals､ and his courtiers,—and the king of Babylon took him, in the eighth year of his reign.

content: 13 And he carried forth from thence､ all the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the house of the king,—and he cut off all the fittings of gold､ which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Yahweh, according to all that Yahweh had spoken.
content_old: 13 And he carried forth from thence､ all the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the house of the king,—and he cut off all the fittings of gold､ which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Yahweh, according to all that Yahweh had spoken.

content: 14 And he carried away all Jerusalem､ and all the generals､ and all the mighty men of valour､ ten thousand becoming captives, and all the artificers and the smiths,—none remained save the poorest of the people of the land.
content_old: 14 And he carried away all Jerusalem､ and all the generals､ and all the mighty men of valour､ ten thousand becoming captives, and all the artificers and the smiths,—none remained save the poorest of the people of the land.

content: 15 And he carried away captive Jehoiachin､ to Babylon,—and the king’s mother､ and the king’s wives､ and his courtiers､ and the nobles of the land took he away captive､ from Jerusalem to Babylon.
content_old: 15 And he carried away captive Jehoiachin､ to Babylon,—and the king’s mother､ and the king’s wives､ and his courtiers､ and the nobles of the land took he away captive､ from Jerusalem to Babylon.

content: 16 And all the men of might—seven thousand､ and artificers and smiths—a thousand, all who were valiant and ready to make war the king of Babylon brought them captive to Babylon.
content_old: 16 And all the men of might—seven thousand､ and artificers and smiths—a thousand, all who were valiant and ready to make war the king of Babylon brought them captive to Babylon.

content: 17 And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah､ his relative､ king in his stead,—and changed his name to Zedekiah.
content_old: 17 And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah､ his relative､ king in his stead,—and changed his name to Zedekiah.

content: 18 Twenty-one years old was Zedekiah when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal､ daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
content_old: 18 Twenty-one years old was Zedekiah when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal､ daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

content: 19 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
content_old: 19 And he did the thing that was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

content: 1 And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign､ in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came—he and all his force against Jerusalem､ and encamped against it,—and they built against it a siege wall､ round about.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign､ in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came—he and all his force against Jerusalem､ and encamped against it,—and they built against it a siege wall､ round about.

content: 2 And the city came into the siege,—until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
content_old: 2 And the city came into the siege,—until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

content: 3 On the ninth of the month, when the famine had become severe in the city,—and there had come to be no bread for the people of the land
content_old: 3 On the ninth of the month, when the famine had become severe in the city,—and there had come to be no bread for the people of the land

content: 4 then was the city broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by way of the gate between the two walls､ which is by the garden of the king, the Chaldeans being near the city round about,—and he went the way of the Waste Plain;
content_old: 4 then was the city broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by way of the gate between the two walls､ which is by the garden of the king, the Chaldeans being near the city round about,—and he went the way of the Waste Plain;

content: 5 and the force of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook him in the Waste Plains of Jericho,—and all his force was scattered from him.
content_old: 5 and the force of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook him in the Waste Plains of Jericho,—and all his force was scattered from him.

content: 6 So they seized the king, and brought him up unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah,—and they pronounced upon him sentence of judgment.
content_old: 6 So they seized the king, and brought him up unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah,—and they pronounced upon him sentence of judgment.

content: 7 And the sons of Zedekiah they slew before his eyes,—and the eyes of Zedekiah put they out, and then bound him with fetters of bronze, and brought him into Babylon.
content_old: 7 And the sons of Zedekiah they slew before his eyes,—and the eyes of Zedekiah put they out, and then bound him with fetters of bronze, and brought him into Babylon.

content: 8 And in the fifth month､ on the seventh of the month, the same was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ servant of the king of Babylon､ to Jerusalem;
content_old: 8 And in the fifth month､ on the seventh of the month, the same was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ servant of the king of Babylon､ to Jerusalem;

content: 9 and burned the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—yea all the houses of Jerusalem､ even every great man’s house burned he with fire.
content_old: 9 and burned the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—yea all the houses of Jerusalem､ even every great man’s house burned he with fire.

content: 10 And the walls of Jerusalem round about did all the force of the Chaldeans who were with the chief of the royal executioners break down.
content_old: 10 And the walls of Jerusalem round about did all the force of the Chaldeans who were with the chief of the royal executioners break down.

content: 11 And the residue of the people who were left in the city､ and the disheartened who fell away unto the king of Babylon, and the residue of tho multitude did Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ carry away captive.
content_old: 11 And the residue of the people who were left in the city､ and the disheartened who fell away unto the king of Babylon, and the residue of tho multitude did Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ carry away captive.

content: 12 But of the poorest of the land did the chief of the royal executioners leave for vine-dressers and for husbandmen.
content_old: 12 But of the poorest of the land did the chief of the royal executioners leave for vine-dressers and for husbandmen.

content: 13 And the pillars of bronze that were in the house of Yahweh､ and the stands, and the sea of bronze which was in the house of Yahweh the Chaldeans brake in pieces､ and they carried away the bronze of them to Babylon;
content_old: 13 And the pillars of bronze that were in the house of Yahweh､ and the stands, and the sea of bronze which was in the house of Yahweh the Chaldeans brake in pieces､ and they carried away the bronze of them to Babylon;

content: 14 and the caldrons､ and the shovels､ and the snuffers､ and the spoons､ even all the utensils of bronze wherewith ministration used to be made did they take away;
content_old: 14 and the caldrons､ and the shovels､ and the snuffers､ and the spoons､ even all the utensils of bronze wherewith ministration used to be made did they take away;

content: 15 and the sprinkling pans and the dashing bowls which were of gold､ in gold, and which were of silver､ in silver did the chief of the royal executioners take away.
content_old: 15 and the sprinkling pans and the dashing bowls which were of gold､ in gold, and which were of silver､ in silver did the chief of the royal executioners take away.

content: 16 As for the two pillars the one sea and the stands which Solomon made for the house of Yahweh without weight was the bronze of all these things.
content_old: 16 As for the two pillars the one sea and the stands which Solomon made for the house of Yahweh without weight was the bronze of all these things.

content: 17 Eighteen cubits was the height of each pillar､ and the capital thereupon was of bronze､ and the height of the capital was three cubits, and the lattice-work and pomegranates upon the capital round about the whole was of bronze; and like these had the second pillar､ upon the lattice-work.
content_old: 17 Eighteen cubits was the height of each pillar､ and the capital thereupon was of bronze､ and the height of the capital was three cubits, and the lattice-work and pomegranates upon the capital round about the whole was of bronze; and like these had the second pillar､ upon the lattice-work.

content: 18 And the chief of the royal executioners took Seraiah the head priest, and Zephaniah the second priest,—and the three keepers of the entrance hall;
content_old: 18 And the chief of the royal executioners took Seraiah the head priest, and Zephaniah the second priest,—and the three keepers of the entrance hall;

content: 19 and out of the city took he one courtier who himself was set over the men of war､ and five men of them who were wont to see the face of the king､ who were found in the city, and the scribe—general of the army, who used to muster the people of the land,—and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the city;
content_old: 19 and out of the city took he one courtier who himself was set over the men of war､ and five men of them who were wont to see the face of the king､ who were found in the city, and the scribe—general of the army, who used to muster the people of the land,—and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the city;

content: 20 and Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ took them,—and brought them unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah;
content_old: 20 and Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ took them,—and brought them unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah;

content: 21 and the king of Babylon smote them and slew them in Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—and thus Judah disappeared from off their own soil.
content_old: 21 and the king of Babylon smote them and slew them in Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—and thus Judah disappeared from off their own soil.

content: 22 But as for the people who were left in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon left remaining he set over them Gedaliah､ son of Ahikam son of Shaphan.
content_old: 22 But as for the people who were left in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon left remaining he set over them Gedaliah､ son of Ahikam son of Shaphan.

content: 23 And when all the generals of the forces, they and the men heard that the king of Babylon had given oversight unto Gedaliah then came they in unto Gedaliah､ at Mizpah,—even Ishmael son of Nethaniah､ and Johanan son of Kareah､ and Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite､ and Jaazaniah son of a Maacathite they and their men.
content_old: 23 And when all the generals of the forces, they and the men heard that the king of Babylon had given oversight unto Gedaliah then came they in unto Gedaliah､ at Mizpah,—even Ishmael son of Nethaniah､ and Johanan son of Kareah､ and Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite､ and Jaazaniah son of a Maacathite they and their men.

content: 24 And Gedaliah sware unto them､ and to their men, and said to them, Do not fear because of the servants of the Chaldeans,—dwell in the land､ and serve the king of Babylon､ and it shall be well with you.
content_old: 24 And Gedaliah sware unto them､ and to their men, and said to them, Do not fear because of the servants of the Chaldeans,—dwell in the land､ and serve the king of Babylon､ and it shall be well with you.

content: 25 And it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama､ of the seed royal､ came､ and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah､ that he died,—and the Jews and the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.
content_old: 25 And it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama､ of the seed royal､ came､ and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah､ that he died,—and the Jews and the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.

content: 26 Then arose all the people both small and great､ and the generals of the forces, and came into Egypt,—for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 26 Then arose all the people both small and great､ and the generals of the forces, and came into Egypt,—for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.

content: 27 And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month,—that Evil-merodach king of Babylon､ in the year that he began to reign､ did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah､ out of prison;
content_old: 27 And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month,—that Evil-merodach king of Babylon､ in the year that he began to reign､ did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah､ out of prison;

content: 28 and he spake with him kind words,—and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon;
content_old: 28 and he spake with him kind words,—and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon;

content: 29 and changed his prison garments,—and he did eat bread continually before him､ all the days of his life.
content_old: 29 and changed his prison garments,—and he did eat bread continually before him､ all the days of his life.
